description:
**Franklin Painting LLC** is currently hiring for a **full\\-time Experienced Painter** with 3\\-5 years of experience to accomplish various professional paint jobs for our **Farmington, CT** clients. This position earns **$20\\-$29\\+ an hour**, based on experience level. We are local industry leaders in this essential skilled trade and believe that hard work can also be fun.

* Training facility
* Overtime opportunities \\- 1\\.5x pay
* Health benefits
* Retirement Plan
* Paid time off
* Year\\-round work


During **late Fall, Winter, and early Spring**, the workweek consists of **five days**, each with **8 hours per day**. In contrast, during **late Spring, Summer, and early Fall**, the workweek consists of **four days**, each with **10 hours per day**.


As one of our Experienced Painters, your ability to safely move, climb, and work from extension ladders allows for productive workdays. You work well with a team during all aspects of residential interior and exterior projects, including prep, paint, and clean up. Whether brush painting or paint spraying, we truly rely on you to assist in the overall success of our business!


Compensation level \\& advancement is based on productivity (work planning/ output) and willingness and ability to manage others.


So, now that you've learned the who, what, where, and why, you may be wondering HOW? It's easy! Just fill out our initial mobile\\-friendly online application. We hope to meet you soon!

**OUR IDEAL PAINTER**


Respectful \\- be kind, positive, and helpful  

Career\\-minded \\- looking for more than a job  

Self\\-motivated \\- sees what needs to be done and does it  

Team player \\- get along well with others and have a true understanding of teamwork Pride in your work \\- real desire to do quality work and ensure customer satisfaction  

Does this sound like you? If so, please continue reading about this full\\-time residential painting technician opportunity!

**ABOUT FRANKLIN PAINTING LLC**


Franklin Paint has one mission, and that is to enhance the appearance and value of residential properties. Aside from the growing need for professional workmanship and quality materials, we understand that the home is one of the most important assets in a person's life. That's why our team leaves each home clean and more beautiful than it has ever been. But perhaps the biggest reason that homeowners keep coming back to us is the comfortable and convenient experience they get with us.


We rely on our skilled team to "paint smiles" and exceed customer expectations. That's why we strive to hire and retain the best. And we offer our employees all things needed to be successful in a personal and professional way including great pay and an exceptional work culture.

**WHAT WE NEED FROM YOU**


3\\-5 years of experience
  

Desire to excel and advance your skill set
  

Ability to join a team effort to produce smiling customers
  

A critical eye to discern quality work and the knowledge to pass it on  

If you are excited about this residential painting technician opportunity and meet these requirements, don't delay. **Apply today**!

Now, we’re searching for a dynamic **Sales Expert** to join our Montgomery County team and be part of this exciting journey!

**Why You’ll Love This Role:**

As a **Sales Expert** at That 1 Painter, you’ll be at the forefront of our business growth. You won’t just be selling services—you’ll be building long\\-lasting relationships that drive success. You’ll have the freedom to generate your own leads, develop partnerships with realtors, interior designers, contractors, and other local professionals, and create new business opportunities that expand our client base.

If you’re proactive, love meeting new people, and are passionate about sales, this role is for you!

* Drive sales and maintain regular follow\\-up to ensure no opportunity is missed.
* Collaborate closely with the internal team to ensure projects are executed smoothly and to the highest standard.
* Provide valuable input into local marketing efforts and use CRM tools to track leads and manage your sales pipeline.

**What You’ll Bring to the Table:**

* A passion for sales, customer service, and building meaningful relationships.
* Excellent communication, negotiation, and interpersonal skills.

* Knowledge of CRM software and modern sales techniques.
* Previous experience in the home services or related industries is a plus.
* A team\\-oriented mindset and the flexibility to adapt to various sales environments.

**Why Work With Us?**

At That 1 Painter, you won’t just be joining a company—you’ll be part of a supportive and driven team that wants to see you succeed. We offer a collaborative environment where your ideas matter, and your hard work will make a tangible difference. If you’re a go\\-getter with a passion for sales and community engagement, this is your chance to shine.

title: Sales/Estimator-Residential and Commercial Painting Contractor
description:

Are you tired of having a ceiling to your earnings?


Are you ready to take on your next challenge where the sky is the limit?


Immediate full\\-time opening for a Residential Painting Sales Consultant in the greater Montgomery County and the surrounding area.


Lauro Painting is a well\\-established residential and commercial painting contractor who is now accepting applications for a Motivated, Organized, and Independent person that can work with our team to estimate and close Interior and Exterior Residential and Commercial Painting Projects. You will benefit from excellent lead flow that exist year round as a result of our 15 years of outstanding work in our area.


Our leadership style creates freedom and flexibility to develop your unique style and achieve your sales goals. You will be part of a supportive and collaborative team where your ideas and feedback are welcome. We offer administrative and marketing support that will allow you to focus on maximizing your time in order to reach your goals. There is no project management required as our excellent operations team will ensure we deliver what you promised. We expect the effort and self\\-management required to be successful and you can expect to be well paid for your results. We have built an excellent culture that values respect and a balanced life. The company paid training and coaching will put you in a position to succeed immediately.


ABOUT THE JOB \\- KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:


To create long lasting, raving fans of Lauro Painting.


This will include:

* Following the Lauro Painting Sales Process


	+ Qualify your leads to make sure they are a good fit for us
	+ Building rapport by asking excellent questions and listening while caring about every prospect you see. We value people above the sale.
	+ Creating trust and value through excellent customer service.
	+ Provide profitable, accurate, detailed, and timely proposals and work orders.
	+ Provide excellent follow up with every customer throughout the sales process.
* Networking


	+ Create opportunities for long term and repeat business through networking and outreach.
	+ Approximately 20% of your time


ABOUT YOU \\- TRAITS AND SKILLS NECESSARY FOR SUCCESS:

* You Close Deals. You have the drive to sell $1\\.5 M per year
* You enjoy the rewards of achieving a high sales volume and the compensation it brings.
* You are able to see challenges and create solutions.
* You are comfortable being on the road 90% of the day while performing 3\\-5 bids daily.
* You demonstrate self\\-control and an ability to manage time and priorities.
* You are accountable for your actions.
* You recover quickly from adversity.
* You are comfortable working independently.
* You treat others fairly, regardless of personal bias or beliefs.


REQUIREMENTS:

* 2\\+ years Sales Experience (Required)
* Painting or construction industry experience (Preferred)
* Willing to dedicate 40\\-50 hours per week to this position
* Relationship management skills and openness to feedback
* **Ability to pass a Background Check and Illegal Drug Test**
* **Proficiency with cloud based technology, apps, and programs.**


SCHEDULE:

* Monday\\-Friday
* Typical hours are 8\\-5 with occasional weekend and evening appointments
* Participation of occasional community events


COMPENSATION:

* Base salary plus commission. $52K Base Salary plus commission.
* $75K 1st year income expected
* $100,000 annual compensation expected by the 2nd year


We are an EEOC Employer

title: Customer Support Agent (Helpdesk)
description:
**Support Analyst (Helpdesk \\& System Admin)**

**Employee Type: Full\\-Time** Exempt

**Employee Location:**

**Required Onsite Monday\\-Friday (must be located within 30\\-minute drive of Audubon, PA)** 

**Reports to: Senior Cloud Administrator**

**Purpose:**

Provide administrative support to Information Technology (IT) support team and perform administrative updates for all end\\-users.

**Who We Are:**

In 1992, CertaPro Painters, Ltd. began with the vision of making residential and commercial painting services easier and more convenient for homeowners and business owners. Our promise has been that of certainty, aiming to reassure customers of our quality and expertise. While today we are the largest residential painting contractor in North America with more than 370 independently owned and operated CertaPro Painters**®** franchised businesses located through the United States and Canada., our locally owned and operated franchises take pride in bringing personalized service to customers in every region, allowing them to focus on what matters most by living our core values.

* ***Deliver What You Promise***
* ***Respect the Individual***
* ***Have Pride in What You Do***
* ***Practice Continuous Improvement***
* ***Embrace Possibilities***

Our people are our greatest asset. We strive to foster a strong culture that embraces diversity and inclusion, attracts those who share our values and offers opportunities for growth. A common thread throughout our organization is our team members’ capacity for caring.

CertaPro Painters® believes that in a world of little or diminishing certainty, we strive to deliver certainty, one extraordinary customer experience at a time. This extends well beyond the time we are privileged to have with our customers while we are entrusted to paint their walls and structures.

**Duties/Responsibilities:**

* Provide excellent customer service for all support queries and adhere to all service management principles.
* Work within our ticketing system to create detailed work logs and technical documentation.
* Provide helpdesk application ticket support and deskside computer support.
* Answer Live Helpdesk support calls, chat, and text.
* Setup, enable, troubleshoot conference room equipment.
* Support franchisees with connectivity to Microsoft Teams / Zoom meetings.
* Creating user accounts, resetting passwords, assigning security rights, database maintenance \\& support, and other duties as assigned.
* Perform remote troubleshooting through diagnostic techniques and pertinent questions.
* Escalate unresolved calls/tickets to the Support Team as needed. As well as set customer expectations for follow\\-up (i.e., when to expect follow\\-up contact and by whom).
* Maintain Computer Supply Inventory.

**Required Skills/Abilities:**

* You have the ability to handle and self\\-prioritize workload to ensure needs are met.
* You are able to think outside the box and able to ask questions and imagine future scenarios, processes, services and products, and ways to leverage technology.
* You are an ongoing learner who exhibits an interest in self\\-improvement.
* You have previous IT Service Desk and/or Call Center experience with AS/AA College degree or applicable work experience.
* You have a fundamental understanding of Microsoft\\-based operating systems with an emphasis on Windows 11 and up, and Office 365/Microsoft Dynamics and/or other CRM\\-based platforms.
* You have a high level of emotional intelligence and an exceptional ability to convey ideas and gain alignment among others, paired with strong analytical and problem\\-solving skills.
* You are customer\\-service oriented and enjoy helping others solve technology issues.

**A Day in The Life:**

Work occurs weekdays at the Corporate Office, usually standing or sitting at a desk. As a Support Analyst, you will constantly interact with Franchisees, Associates, and corporate staff to answer questions and give advice. Support is provided remotely, but travel is required twice a year to attend annual Corporate Meetings and the National Conference and may include other travel as needed.

**Our Pledge:**

CertaPro Painters, Ltd. is an equal\\-opportunity employer. Employment decisions at CertaPro will be based on merit, qualifications, and abilities to provide equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants CertaPro prohibits discrimination and harassment based on an individual’s race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local laws.

title: Production Supervisor
description:
About Us:

Perfectionist Painting and Home Improvement is a premier provider of high\\-quality home renovation services servicing NYC and Long Island. We are known for our meticulous attention to detail and commitment to customer satisfaction. As we continue to expand, we are looking for a hands\\-on leader who enjoys working in the field and managing teams, with the potential to grow into a leadership role.

Job Overview:

The Manager/Project Coordinator will play a critical role in ensuring seamless operations across all job sites and maintaining the high standards our clients have come to expect. This is a hands\\-on role that involves being in the field regularly, working alongside the team to ensure projects meet our high standards. You will start by shadowing the owner, with the long\\-term vision of stepping into a leadership role that could eventually include a structured path to ownership.

Key Responsibilities:

* Leadership Training: Shadow the owner to gain insight into our operations, workflows, and client relations.
* Quality Control: Conduct regular visits to job sites to ensure projects are completed to the highest standards and on schedule.
* Compliance Management: Handle all compliance\\-related matters, including coordination with property managers, processing insurance, managing licensing, and overseeing contracts.
* Resource Management: Efficiently manage material acquisition and inventory, including trips to suppliers and coordinating shop and vehicle organization. This includes physical tasks such as organizing supplies, maintaining a clean and orderly shop environment, and managing tools and materials.
* Team Coordination: Act as a central communication point between the owner, team members, and clients, ensuring that all parties remain aligned and informed.
* Flexibility in Communication: While communications may occur from 7 am to 8 pm, this varies depending on project needs and is not constant.
* Site Presence \\& Travel: While laborers typically work from 8 am to 5 pm, the Manager/Project Coordinator is not required to be on\\-site for the full duration. Some days will involve off\\-site planning and coordination, while others may include weekend availability. Additionally, some weeks may require up to 15 hours of driving between job sites and suppliers.

Qualifications \\& Skills:

* Education: High school diploma or equivalent is required.
* Bilingual Ability: Spanish\\-speaking skills are not required, however highly valuable and aid in communication with a diverse workforce.
* Industry Knowledge: Experience in painting, renovations, and general home improvement is preferred.
* Technical Skills: Ability to contribute on\\-site with skills in painting, plaster, carpentry, tile work, and basic plumbing and electrical work is beneficial but not mandatory.
* Leadership \\& Communication: Strong interpersonal skills, an ability to listen attentively, and a natural inclination towards leadership and teamwork.
* Adaptability: Willingness to adapt to evolving project needs and take on challenges as they arise.
* Clean Driving Record: A clean driver’s license is required, along with comfort in navigating work vehicles through NYC.

Compensation:

* Salary: Competitive annual salary between $60,000 and $120,000, depending on experience in managing job sites, technical skills, and leadership ability.
* Paid Time Off: Includes 2 weeks of paid time off.
* Growth Opportunity: The role offers a clear path to increased responsibilities, with the potential to become a partner and eventually transition into ownership.

Career Path:

This role is designed for those who want to grow into leadership. With proven performance, you can take on more responsibility, manage client communications, and transition into ownership.

How to Apply:

Please submit your resume and a brief cover letter that highlights your relevant experience, skills, and why you are the ideal candidate for this opportunity.

As our Pro Sales Associate at Behr, you’ll be working in a Home Depot store as a sales specialist focusing on professional painting contractors and their unique needs. On your own and working with the Pro Desk staff, you’ll meet and form relationships with local pros who rely on Behr for excellent products and exceptional customer service. You will build relationships with pros in the store who may be there for paint but are more likely there for something else. * Basic computer skills. You’ll enter all your new leads and contacts into Salesforce, our customer relationship management tool. We can train you on this program, but all prior computer knowledge is a plus.
* Bilingual. You are not required to speak a second language, but many of our professional contractors do. If you have this knowledge, that’s definitely a bonus.

title: Commercial Painter Crew Lead
description:
**Commercial Painter Crew Lead**

**DO YOU STRIVE TO BE THE BEST???**

**DO YOU HAVE AN EXELLENT WORK ETHIC???**

**DO YOU WANT TO JOIN A WINNING TEAM OF ALL STARS???**

**IF YOU HAVE ALL THOSE QUALIFICATIONS, THEN YOU ARE A PERFECT FIT FOR OUR TEAM!!!**

**ABOUT OUR COMPANY**

Since 1975, Alpine Painting has provided painting \\& floor coating services for the Tri\\-State Area. Alpine Painting and Sandblasting, has years of surface preparation and coating application experience in a wide variety of facilities, including Warehouses, Hospitals, Manufacturing Facilities, or any project that demands commercial \\& industrial painting services. Our reputation of quality is achieved from our knowledge of materials and unrivaled expertise in the preparation and application of coating systems. At Alpine Painting, we know that great employees lead to great service, and, through our expert staff with established systems, our team and business will continue to expand for years to come.

We are currently seeking an experienced and skilled Commercial Painter Crew Lead to join our team. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in commercial painting and leadership, with the ability to lead a crew effectively and ensure projects are completed to the highest standards.

**Responsibilities:**

* Lead and supervise a team of painters on commercial painting projects, ensuring quality workmanship and adherence to project timelines.
* Plan and organize daily tasks and assignments for the painting crew, including preparation, painting, and cleanup activities.
* Oversee surface preparation, including sanding, scraping, patching, and priming, to ensure a smooth and even paint finish.
* Apply paint, stain, varnish, and other finishes to interior and exterior surfaces, including walls, ceilings, floors, and trim, using brushes, rollers, and sprayers.
* Inspect work progress and finished surfaces to ensure quality standards are met and address any issues or deficiencies promptly.
* Coordinate with project managers, contractors, and clients to communicate project requirements, timelines, and updates.
* Maintain a safe and organized work environment, including proper handling and storage of painting materials and equipment.
* Train and mentor crew members, providing guidance on painting techniques, safety procedures, and best practices.

**Qualifications:**

* Proven experience as a commercial painter, with a minimum of 5 years of relevant experience in commercial painting projects.
* Demonstrated leadership skills and experience leading a painting crew or team of workers.
* Strong knowledge of painting techniques, materials, and equipment used in commercial painting applications.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to effectively communicate with clients, contractors, and team members.
* Detail\\-oriented with a focus on quality craftsmanship and attention to detail.
* Ability to work independently and as part of a team in a fast\\-paced environment.
* Valid driver's license and reliable transportation.
* Authorized to work in the U.S for any employer

**Benefits:**

* Competitive salary based on experience and qualifications
* Health: 90% of Single Employee \\+ portion of family; Dental; Vision
* 401K
* Paid time off and holidays
* Fun Company events
* Opportunities for advancement and professional development

SCHEDULE:

* Typical Business Hours: 7:00\\-3:30, with flexibility
* Location: Our Office

To arrange a **confidential** interview, send your **resume** along with a **cover letter** explaining what you like about this opportunity to: sidra@alpinepainting.com; Visit our web site: **www.AlpinePainting.com**

title: Painters
description:
**Select Painting \\& Construction, Inc. has been in business for over 31 years. We are a family owned and operated business since 1991\\.** What separates us from the competition is that we ensure every job is done with the best ***quality*** in the industry.

Our Painting Division is seeking ***Experienced Exterior, Painter I and Painter II*** for our current open positions located in the following counties: Los Angeles County and Ventura County areas.

**Painter** 

* May assist in preparing the surrounding area by taping off and masking areas, covering with cloth or plastic to prevent messes
* Removes any old paint, sanding, scraping and power washing surfaces to prepare for paint
* Fills nail holes, cracks, and joints with caulk, putty, plaster, or other filler, using caulking gun and putty knife
* Reads paint specifications
* Mixes and applies paints
* Paints various surfaces through several methods of painting (rolling, brushing and spraying or the ability to learn to spray)
* Retains knowledge of spray machines and pressure washers
* Uses back rolling method when Painter I and II are spraying
* Applies touch ups or second coats
* Assists in cleaning any paint splatters
* Performs preventive maintenance on brushes and any equipment utilized
* \\>2\\+ years in the trade preferred

**Painter II**

* Works with Painter Helper and Painter I
* May assist supervisor in many areas including training
* Advance knowledge of equipment and utilization for painting tasks assigned
* May assists in removing any old paint, sanding, scraping and power washing surfaces to prepare for paint
* Fills nail holes, cracks, and joints with caulk, putty, plaster, or other filler, using caulking gun and putty knife, including repair and texture stucco cracks
* Reads paint specifications
* Mixes and applies paints
* Paints various surfaces with advance knowledge in all methods of painting (rolling, brushing and **spraying**). **Must know how to Spray.**
* Advance knowledge of spray machines and pressure washers
* Applies touch ups or second coats

title: Pro Sales Associate - San Bernardino
description:
To thrive as a Pro Paint Specialist, you must be approachable, organized, and genuinely interested in helping our customers. Some basic computer skills are necessary to use our customer management software. An outgoing personality with a positive attitude will help you start up conversations with strangers and being a self\\-starter will be useful as well so you can jump in and help wherever you see a need. You don’t need to have any previous experience or knowledge in paint or sales. We’ll teach you everything you need to know, which makes this a perfect starting point to launch your career.


As our PPS or Pro Paint Specialist with Behr, you’ll be working in a Home Depot store as a sales specialist focusing on professional painting contractors and their unique needs. On your own and working with the Pro Desk staff, you’ll meet and form relationships with local pros who rely on Behr for excellent products and exceptional customer service. You will build relationships with pros in the store who may be there for paint but are more likely there for something else. When an outside rep sends a contractor to you for paint, you will roll out the red carpet by collaborating with them to get exactly the right products for their needs, mix the paint, collect any sundry paint tools they need and get them in and out of the store quickly so they can get back to work. You will make our professional customers feel like they had a paint store experience.

**Here’s what we’re looking for from you:**

* An outgoing personality. You’ll will support the Home Depot Pro Desk and introduce yourself to any contractors. Get to know them, their business, and their needs. You’ll maintain this relationship and follow up regarding their jobs and any future needs.
* Collaboration. You’ll work closely with Behr’s outside sales reps and take care of our customers when they come into the store, including pulling and tinting orders for pick up. You’ll also work closely with the Home Depot staff. We are all one team, so as their vendor you’ll be professional and helpful, working to maintain this mutually beneficial relationship.
* Basic computer skills. You’ll enter all your new leads and contacts into Salesforce, our customer relationship management tool. We can train you on this program, but all prior computer knowledge is a plus.
* Bilingual. You are not required to speak a second language, but many of our professional contractors do. If you have this knowledge, that’s definitely a bonus.
* A completed high school education (High School Diploma or GED)

**Here’s what we offer you:**

* Competitive pay and bonus opportunities. Sell more gallons \\= more money!
* Accrue 15 paid days off the first year.
* 401(k) retirement plan with 4% match.
* Competitive health plans for individuals and families.
* Check out behr.com/careers to view a comprehensive list of our benefits and perks.


Founded in 1947, Behr Paint Company is one of the largest manufacturers of paints, primers, decorative finishes, stains, surface preparation, and application products for do\\-it\\-yourselfers and professionals in the United States, Canada, Mexico, China, and Chile. The Santa Ana, Calif.\\-based company and maker of the BEHR®, KILZ®, WHIZZ®, and E\\&J® brands is dedicated to meeting the project needs of DIYers, professionals, architects, and designers with an unwavering commitment to quality, innovation, and value. At Behr Paint, we strive to have all team members bring their best selves and their unique perspectives every day.

title: Painter
description:
Industrial Painter is a successful, growing company which specializes in painting commercial and industrial facilities throughout the United States. We are committed to creating intimate customer relationships that distinguish Industrial Painter as a premier business partner for our customers.


We are seeking a skilled Industrial Painter to join our team. The Industrial Painter will be responsible for painting the interiors and exteriors of industrial buildings. This role requires flexibility to work day or night shifts as the project needs dictate. Traveling throughout the Chicagoland area will be a regular part of the job, and the candidate must possess a valid driver's license with a good driving record.

**Responsibilities:**

* Prepare surfaces for painting by cleaning, scraping, sanding, and smoothing surfaces.
* Apply paint, varnish, and other coatings using brushes, rollers, and spray guns.
* Mix and match paints and finishes according to job requirements.
* Cover surfaces with appropriate materials such as cloth or plastic to ensure protection during painting.
* Calculate quantities of required materials and estimate costs.
* Operate and maintain painting equipment and tools.
* Follow safety guidelines and maintain a safe work environment.

 **Requirements:**

* Proven experience as an Industrial Painter or similar role.
* Knowledge of painting techniques and tools.
* Ability to work at heights and in confined spaces.
* Flexibility to work day or night shifts as required.
* Valid driver's license and a good driving record.
* Willingness to travel.
* Physical stamina and strength to lift and move heavy equipment.

 **Preferred Skills:**

* Certification in painting or relevant field.
* Experience with industrial painting projects.
* Familiarity with Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA) regulations.

 **Benefits:**

* Competitive salary based on experience.
* Generous production bonus per week
* Early completion bonus and cost saving bonus
* Opportunities for training and career advancement.

title: Painter
description:
**Job Overview**  
We are seeking a skilled Painter to join our team. The ideal candidate will have experience in both residential and commercial painting, with a strong understanding of various painting techniques and materials. This role requires attention to detail, a commitment to quality, and the ability to work independently or as part of a team. The Painter will be responsible for preparing surfaces, applying paint, and ensuring that all work meets high standards of quality. A reliable, unmarked truck or van is required for transportation to job sites.

**Duties**  
\\- Prepare surfaces for painting by cleaning, sanding, and filling holes or imperfections.  
\\- Apply paint using brushes, rollers, and airless paint spraying equipment.  
\\- Read and interpret blueprints and schematics to determine painting requirements.  
\\- Install fixtures as needed during renovation projects.  
\\- Work with various materials including masonry and plaster.  
\\- Utilize power tools safely and effectively for various tasks.  
\\- Collaborate with other tradespeople to ensure project timelines are met.  
\\- Maintain a clean and organized work area throughout the duration of projects.

**Skills**  
\\- Proficient in reading schematics and blueprints.  
\\- Strong basic math skills for measuring areas and calculating paint quantities.  
\\- Experience in commercial painting projects is preferred.  
\\- Knowledge of fixture installation techniques.  
\\- Familiarity with airless paint spraying methods.  
\\- Ability to work with masonry and plaster finishes.  
\\- Competence in using power tools safely in various applications.  
\\- Attention to detail with a focus on delivering high\\-quality results.

Join our team as a Painter where your skills will contribute to creating beautiful spaces while working in a supportive environment that values craftsmanship and professionalism.

Job Type: Contract

Pay: $300\\.00 per day

Work Location: On the road

title: Office Assiociate Needed
description:
Office Associate

CertaPro Painters of Pearland and Central Fort Bend has an exciting opportunity for a full\\-time Office Associate to join our team. We are a fast\\-growing company with a friendly, family and team oriented culture.  
CertaPro Painters is a leader in the residential and commercial painting industry. We are a national organization of professional painting contractors specializing in beautifying homes and buildings, interiors, exteriors, commercial, offices, and condominiums. Our success has been built on the foundation of delivering certainty to our customers – certainty of a job well done. We focus on the details of every project and most importantly, we focus on the client.   
\\*\\*  
**Position Overview**

The Office Associate will report to the Owner and provide support to the following functions: Marketing, Sales, and Business Development. Candidate must be flexible, demonstrate good organization skills and attention to detail, be able to multi\\-task and speak confidently on the phone.

Responsibilities:

· Collaborate as a valuable member of the CertaPro team  
· Manage administrative aspects of our office.   
· Answer the phone and schedule estimates in calendars for multiple Sales Associates  
· Create invoices and collect money from customers  
· Answer customer inquiries  
· Interact with customers and painting crews  
· Create weekly payroll, and close completed jobs 

Qualifications/Certifications:  
· High school diploma or equivalent  
· Organized and attention to detail oriented  
· Excellent knowledge of Microsoft Office packages (Teams, Word, and Excel)  
· Comfortable with technology and multitasking  
· Excellent verbal and written communication skills  
· Excellent organizational and time management skills  
· Able to deliver customer service excellence  
· Good using initiative  
· Ability to follow through with tasks  
· Be energetic and work well unsupervised

· Want to be part of a growing company with a friendly, family, team\\-oriented culture

Benefits/Compensation:  
· This is an hourly position with an expectation of 40 hours a week. The wage will be between $20 and $23 an hour depending on experience. (This is equivalent to approx. $41,000 and $47,000 a year)   
· 3 weeks paid vacation will be given.   
· Work cell phone  
There may be an opportunity for this to become a full time salaried position.   
\\*\\*  
**Location:** 2542 Garden Road, Pearland, TX 77581\\. (This is not a remote position)  
\\*\\*

**Applicants:** Candidates should send their cover letter and resume to Mark Cooper at mcooper@certapro.com.

Location: 2542 Garden Road, Pearland, Texas 77581

Job Type: Full\\-time

Pay: $20\\.00 \\- $23\\.00 per hour

title: Sub-Contractor Painter
description:
**Job Overview**  
We are seeking a skilled and reliable Subcontractor to join our team. The ideal candidate will possess a diverse skill set in various construction trades, including drywall installation, industrial and residential painting, and carpentry. This role requires a strong attention to detail and the ability to work independently or as part of a team on various projects. The Subcontractor will be responsible for ensuring that all work is completed to the highest standards of quality and safety.

**Responsibilities**

* Execute drywall installation and finishing tasks with precision.
* Perform industrial and residential painting, ensuring a clean and professional finish.
* Utilize power tools safely and effectively for various construction tasks.
* Read and interpret schematics to understand project requirements.
* Apply caulking as needed to seal gaps and improve finishes.
* Collaborate with other tradespeople on construction sites to ensure timely project completion.
* Maintain a clean and organized work area, adhering to safety protocols at all times.
* Assist in renovating spaces according to client specifications.

**Requirements**

* Proven experience in drywall installation, industrial painting, or residential painting preferred.
* Strong understanding of basic math skills for measurements and calculations.
* Familiarity with construction site protocols and safety regulations.
* Ability to read blueprints or schematics effectively.
* Proficient in using various power tools relevant to the trade.
* Experience with caulking techniques is a plus.
* Knowledge of frame carpentry practices is desirable.
* Strong problem\\-solving skills and attention to detail are essential.
* Ability to work independently as well as part of a team in a fast\\-paced environment.

If you are passionate about construction and possess the necessary skills, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity as a Subcontractor!

Job Types: Full\\-time, Part\\-time, Contract

Pay: $150\\.00 \\- $200\\.00 per day

Expected hours: 30 – 40 per week

Benefits:

* Flexible schedule

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Day shift
* Monday to Friday
* Weekends as needed

title: Experienced Painter - Paint Crew Leader
description:
If you're a seasoned professional with a passion for leading painting crews, we invite you to seize an exceptional opportunity with **ACP Painting, LLC**. As an **Experienced Painter \\- Paint Crew Leader**, you'll play a pivotal role in our Maricopa, AZ team while earning a competitive wage of **$21 to $23 per hour**.


We offer our team amazing benefits including 40 hours of sick pay annually. Wait there's more! After 60 days of employment, we offer dental, vision, health, and supplemental insurance benefits. After 90 days of employment, employees receive an accrual of paid vacation time, 6 paid holidays, and a discounted corporate gym membership. After 1 year of employment, we also offer a SIMPLE IRA program plan. We even match your contribution up to 4% of your yearly salary with this program.


If you're ready for a full\\-time position with room for career growth, your journey starts here. Take the helm of your painting crew\\-apply now!

 **DISCOVER WHO WE ARE:**


We are a professional painting company that's been providing high\\-quality services to residential and commercial clients in the Southern Phoenix metro area since 2005\\. Our mission is to create long\\-term customer relationships through utilizing our three core values: accountability, collaboration, and preservation. We strive to provide an exceptional customer experience by having open and honest communication throughout the entire process.


Because our employees are at the heart of our company, we offer **competitive pay, great benefits, and an uplifting work environment**. To be the best, we make sure that our team members **receive the best training** and are **supported in their personal and professional goals**. If you're looking for a great place to work, look no further!

**YOUR DAY\\-TO\\-DAY AS AN EXPERIENCED PAINTER \\- PAINT CREW LEADER:**


In this pivotal role, envision yourself at the helm, expertly leading your crew to success. Your responsibilities encompass maintaining open lines of professional communication with clients and ensuring unwavering adherence to rigorous quality standards, all while meticulously following approved plans and specifications. You'll strategically devise schedules that seamlessly align with critical project milestones and completion dates, providing clear and effective guidance to your team to ensure the precise realization of project objectives. Active participation in project meetings will showcase your adeptness in proactive problem\\-solving, and your adept management of materials will present work sites in a consistently clean, organized, and professional manner. Additionally, you'll nurture the professional development of your crew, fostering a positive and vibrant work environment that aligns perfectly with our corporate culture.

 **WHAT WE NEED FROM YOU:**

* Highly skilled Lead Hand with experience managing crew members on site
* Knowledge about alkyd materials and paint chemistry, including vehicle, binder, and pigment
* Knowledge about MSDS and tech datasheet uses
* Knowledge about job costing and the ability to estimate small jobs up to $1,500
* Basic carpentry skills including the ability to replace, install, and repair fascia board, door trim, door casings, and baseboards
* Valid driver's license with reliable transportation
* Willing to learn

 **ADVANCE YOUR CAREER TODAY!**


ACP Painting, LLC invites you to be a driving force behind our commitment to excellence. Applying is swift, convenient, and mobile\\-friendly. Apply today for the role of Experienced Painter \\- Paint Crew Leader and set your course toward a brighter future!

* 40 hours of sick pay annually

 **DAY\\-TO\\-DAY**

One of the ways you ensure efficiency is by communicating with clients prior to starting each new job. Based on what you learn from them, you're able to plan and execute each project using your exceptional time management skills. You also use your exceptional leadership skills to train less experienced painters so that they can improve their skills. Some of your other responsibilities include ordering supplies, estimating labor requirements, mapping a timeline, closing out jobs, and preparing work orders. No matter what type of job you're managing, you consistently complete projects on time and within the budget. **You find great fulfillment in leading a cohesive team of painters and using your skills to contribute to our company's success!**

* Go\\-getter \\- consistently goes above and beyond when it comes to quality, accuracy, and efficiency
* Problem\\-solver \\- approaches situations with an analytical mind and can quickly and appropriately resolve problems

title: Sales Executive
description:
**Job Overview**  
Arizona Pool Painting LLC is a rapidly growing company offering high\\-quality, affordable pool coating services across Arizona. As a disrupter in the pool service industry, we specialize in providing an affordable alternative to costly pool remodels. Our expert pool coating and refinishing services help homeowners and businesses rejuvenate their pools without the need for expensive renovations. Instead we offer an economical way to restore the beauty and durability of their pool. With a focus on delivering outstanding customer experiences, we are expanding quickly and looking for motivated sales professionals to help us grow.

**Duties**

* **Lead Generation:** Actively prospect new clients through a variety of methods, including social media, networking, referrals, outreach via phone calls and emails as well as home shows.
* **On\\-Site Assessments:** Visit customer properties to measure the pool, assess their condition, and determine any necessary repairs or prep work needed for pool recoating.
* **Quote Preparation:** Based on on\\-site assessments, write up detailed and accurate quotes that include all required services, repairs, and coatings. Provide a clear explanation of the costs and benefits of choosing a pool recoat over a full remodel.
* **Consultations \\& Presentations:** Meet with potential clients to discuss their needs, explain how our affordable resurfacing options can rejuvenate their pools, and present the benefits of choosing a pool recoat as a cost\\-effective alternative to traditional renovations.

**Qualifications:**

* Proven experience in sales, particularly in inside sales or outside sales roles.
* Previous sales experience, particularly in home services, construction, or the pool industry, is preferred but not required.
* Ability to measure pools accurately and assess the scope of work required for resurfacing and repairs.
* Excellent communication, negotiation, and closing skills.
* Self\\-motivated, goal\\-oriented, and eager to succeed in a commission\\-based environment.
* Ability to work independently, manage your own schedule, and meet with clients at convenient times.
* A reliable vehicle and valid driver’s license are required.
* Familiarity with CRM tools is a plus, but not mandatory.
* Experience in the pool industry or home improvement is a plus, but we provide comprehensive training for the right candidates.

Impact Lives Every Day! When you join Arizona Pool Painting, you're not just selling a service—you’re helping families create a space where they can enjoy countless moments of joy without breaking the bank.

title: Pro Sales Associate- Phoenix
description:
To thrive as a Pro Sales Associate, you must be approachable, organized, and genuinely interested in helping our customers. Some basic computer skills are necessary to use our customer management software. An outgoing personality with a positive attitude will help you start up conversations with strangers and being a self\\-starter will be useful as well so you can jump in and help wherever you see a need. You don’t need to have any previous experience or knowledge in paint or sales. We’ll teach you everything you need to know, which makes this a perfect starting point to launch your career.

  

As our Pro Sales Associate at Behr, you’ll be working in a Home Depot store as a sales specialist focusing on professional painting contractors and their unique needs. On your own and working with the Pro Desk staff, you’ll meet and form relationships with local pros who rely on Behr for excellent products and exceptional customer service. You will build relationships with pros in the store who may be there for paint but are more likely there for something else. When an outside rep sends a contractor to you for paint, you will roll out the red carpet by collaborating with them to get exactly the right products for their needs, mix the paint, collect any sundry paint tools they need and get them in and out of the store quickly so they can get back to work. You will make our professional customers feel like they had a paint store experience.

  

Here’s what we’re looking for from you:

* An outgoing personality. You’ll support the Home Depot Pro Desk and introduce yourself to any contractors. Get to know them, their business, and their needs. You’ll maintain this relationship and follow up regarding their jobs and any future needs.
* Collaboration. You’ll work closely with Behr’s outside sales reps and take care of our customers when they come into the store, including pulling and tinting orders for pick up. You’ll also work closely with the Home Depot staff. We are all one team, so as their vendor you’ll be professional and helpful, working to maintain this mutually beneficial relationship.
* Basic computer skills. You’ll enter all your new leads and contacts into Salesforce, our customer relationship management tool. We can train you on this program, but all prior computer knowledge is a plus.
* Bilingual. You are not required to speak a second language, but many of our professional contractors do. If you have this knowledge, that’s definitely a bonus.
* A high school diploma or GED equivalent is required for all roles at Behr Paint Company.
  

Here’s what we offer you:

* Competitive pay and bonus opportunities. Sell more gallons \\= more money!
* Accrue 15 paid days off the first year.
* 401(k) retirement plan with 4% match.
* Competitive health plans for individuals and families.
* Check out behr.com/careers to view a comprehensive list of our benefits and perks.
  

Founded in 1947, Behr Paint Company is one of the largest manufacturers of paints, primers, decorative finishes, stains, surface preparation, and application products for do\\-it\\-yourselfers and professionals in the United States, Canada, Mexico, China, and Chile. The Santa Ana, Calif.\\-based company and maker of the BEHR®, KILZ®, WHIZZ®, and E\\&J® brands is dedicated to meeting the project needs of DIYers, professionals, architects, and designers with an unwavering commitment to quality, innovation, and value. At Behr Paint, we strive to have all team members bring their best selves and their unique perspectives every day.

**Company: Behr Paint Company**

title: Operations Manager (Commercial Paint)
description:
PaintJet is redefining the commercial painting industry by introducing advanced robotics, AI and material sciences to optimize the coating process. Our automated approach tackles the systemic labor shortage by focusing on increasing painter productivity and precision application while reducing material waste. We are hiring an Operations Manager to ensure operational excellence throughout the Arizona region. The primary role of the Operations Manager is to lead the development and oversight of all PaintJet construction field operations and processes in the Arizona market. In this versatile role, you will partner with the local Business Unit Director and key operations personnel to oversee the day\\-to\\-day field operations of both sub\\-contracted and direct personnel. You will assist in building an operational foundation to support PaintJet's high\\-growth model. This position is best suited for a flexible, action\\-oriented person who is self\\-driven and thrives in ambiguous settings.


The Impact You'll Make in This Role:


The Operations Manager is a highly visible role responsible for helping PaintJet become an exponentially scalable organization. In this position, you will have a direct impact on the company's gross margins and improved information flow intended to drive organizational and operational excellence. The ideal Operations Manager will have a strong background in managing large scale commercial painting operations preferably in exterior vertical concrete coating projects.

  

**As PaintJet's** **Operations Manager, you will:**


* **Build and drive a strong operational culture in the Phoenix market**
* Implementing process framework to ensure a secure, stable, efficient, and standardized operating environment
* Recruit and build the local operations team.
* Integrate technology into the operating environment. This includes robotics, field apps and AI to enable rapid scale, improve gross margin and improve delivery to customers
* Develop and drive construction schedules across a variety of projects and customer types
* Build, maintain, and grow relationships with company's vendors and partners
* Support creating and managing your department's annual operating plan, including financial forecast, KPI, OKRs and talent resource needs


**To set you up for success in this role from day one, PaintJet is looking for candidates who have the following:**


*Skills, Abilities, Attitude*


* Exceptional organizational, communication, and presentation skills across all organizational levels
* Can\\-do mindset with the ability to multitask and maintain composure during stressful situations
* High aptitude to learn quickly, assimilate to new teams and projects, and work well under pressure with appropriate attention to detail
* Strong interpersonal presence, and ability to collaborate cross\\-functionally with people from various teams and various backgrounds
* Ability to inspire and influence those around you, even without direct management responsibility
* Quick learner and critical thinker; able to dig into complex processes and data to inform operational decisions
* Comfortable with the pace and dynamic environment within a growing organization


*Education \\& Work Related Experience*


* High school diploma required; bachelor's degree strongly preferred
* 7\\+ years of experience in the commercial painting industry with proven success in a Superintendent or other managerial position
* Prior process design and management experience with proven planning, organizing, communication, and execution skills
* Successful track record of introducing new technologies, systems, processes, policies and procedures into an organization
* Demonstrated experience collaborating and/or managing multiple remote teams simultaneously
* Understanding of operational and financial drivers that impact operational success


**Reasons why it pays to work at PaintJet (besides the pay itself!)**


**In addition to a hands\\-on, fun work environment with likable co\\-workers, PaintJet also offers:**


* Competitive base salary and performance bonuses
* 11 paid holidays and unlimited PTO
* Health, dental, and vision insurance
* Short\\- and Long\\-Term Disability, AD\\&D, and Life Insurance
* 401(k) plan
* Company equity options
* Exceptional training opportunities


Target Salary Range: $110,000 \\- $125,000 annually \\+ potential productivity bonus


Work Hours: This position requires the incumbent to be available during core business hours


Work Location: Remote with travel to job sites


Travel Requirements: This position requires the incumbent to travel for up to 50% of the time


Don't meet every single requirement? Studies have shown that women and people of color are less likely to apply to jobs unless they meet every. single. qualification. At PaintJet, we are dedicated to building a diverse, inclusive and just workplace, so if you're excited about this role but your past experience doesn't align perfectly with 100% of the qualifications listed, we encourage you to still apply. Our hiring philosophy looks to weed people INTO our process, not weed them out! Who knows, you may be just the right candidate for a future role with PaintJet. Just go for it... submit your resume!


PaintJet is an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to diversity and inclusion in the workplace. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, race, color, age, national origin, religion, physical and mental disability, genetic information, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity/assignment, citizenship, pregnancy or maternity, protected veteran status, or any other status prohibited by applicable national, federal, state or local law.

title: Industrial Painter
description:
Industrial Painter is a successful, growing company which specializes in painting commercial and industrial facilities throughout the United States. We are committed to creating intimate customer relationships that distinguish Industrial Painter as a premier business partner for our customers.


We are seeking a skilled Industrial Painter to join our team. The Industrial Painter will be responsible for painting the interiors and exteriors of industrial buildings. This role requires flexibility to work day or night shifts as the project needs dictate. Travel will be a regular part of the job, and the candidate must possess a valid driver's license with a good driving record. While traveling, the company provides daily allowances for food and accommodation.

 **Responsibilities:**

* Prepare surfaces for painting by cleaning, scraping, sanding, and smoothing surfaces.
* Apply paint, varnish, and other coatings using brushes, rollers, and spray guns.
* Mix and match paints and finishes according to job requirements.
* Cover surfaces with appropriate materials such as cloth or plastic to ensure protection during painting.
* Calculate quantities of required materials and estimate costs.
* Operate and maintain painting equipment and tools.
* Follow safety guidelines and maintain a safe work environment.

 **Requirements:**

* Proven experience as an Industrial Painter or similar role.
* Knowledge of painting techniques and tools.
* Ability to work at heights and in confined spaces.
* Flexibility to work day or night shifts as required.
* Valid driver's license and a good driving record.
* Willingness to travel.
* Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
* Physical stamina and strength to lift and move heavy equipment.

 **Preferred Skills:**

* Certification in painting or relevant field.
* Experience with industrial painting projects.
* Familiarity with Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA) regulations.

 **Benefits:**

* Competitive salary based on experience.
* Generous production bonus per week
* Early completion bonus and cost saving bonus
* Opportunities for training and career advancement.

title: Location Sales Manager
description:
Established in 2011, That 1 Painter is the fastest growing painting company in the nation offering a wide range of 18 different service options. Our unwavering commitment to exceptional workmanship ensures the highest quality outcomes, creating not just stunning results but also great satisfaction. Our Brand Promise is to be The Best House Guest Ever. If you possess a passion for delivering unparalleled customer service and desire to be part of a company with a remarkable culture, we look forward to meeting you!

That 1 Painter of Central PA has an outstanding opportunity for an experienced Location Manager. As a Location Manager, you will be responsible for maintaining the highest level of customer/prospect satisfaction, estimating job costs, closing new and repeat business and achieving budgeted sales goals for your territory. This is accomplished through relentless follow\\-through and constant communication with prospects, clients, vendors and partners as well as daily in\\-person appointments with both customers and referral partners.

**The basics of the role:**

● Estimating in person and on\\-site (and virtually as needed) with prospects daily M\\-F

● Recruit and manage subcontractors \\[Painting Crews]

● Accurately estimating labor/materials and submitting the quote to the customer within 24 hours of appointment

● Following up with all quotes seven times within six months OR until approved/rejected

● Scheduling approved estimates in accordance with Management’s process \\[will train]

● Collecting deposits before the start of each job

● Upselling clients on additional services

● Communicating with customers concerning colors, sheens and other basic preparations before the job starts

● Ensure all jobs are appropriately staffed

● Ensure projects are kept on schedule and within budget while meeting client’s needs and delivering a quality project

● Help problem solve with Crew Leads if problems arise on any project

● Work with office to ensure paint/supplies are ordered accurately and timely per defined process

● Attend home shows, commercial trade events and other networking events and advertising opportunities as the

primary representative of That 1 Painter

● Constantly pursuing strategic relationships on behalf of That 1 Painter, developing a referral network to

generate leads and utilizing all T1P processes \\& methodologies to aid the company in lead generation

● Utilize the T1P Sales process, tools, software and other technologies to streamline the process for the customer

and fellow team members alike

**The ideal candidate will have:**

● Two years of experience in Sales or Project Management

● Exceptional, ‘over\\-the\\-top’ customer service experience

● Polished and professional demeanor

● Driven and self\\-motivated with a strong sales acumen

● Open and honest communicator, accountable, passionate, confident and FUN

● Clean driving record

● House Call Pro experience a plus, but not required \\[will train]

● Experience generating own leads (in addition to provided leads) via strategic relationships and any and all means \\[will train]

● Ability to establish and maintain rapport and effective working relationships with teammates, managers, subcontractors, and clients

● Ability to multi\\-task and prioritize duties while maintaining a high level of organization

● Detail\\-oriented, dependable, and reliable

● Ability to accurately estimate product and labor costs \\[will train]

● Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal

● Excellent analytical and problem\\-solving skills

● Proficiency in using a personal computer, cell phone, and software programs

● Confidence in communicating paint products and services \\[will train]

● Successful completion of a background and reference check

**Compensation Package:**

● ● $4k/mo base salary

● 7\\-8% commission on completed projects once established sales threshold achieved

Perks of this position:

● Paid Training

● Company Truck

● Gas Card

● Mobile Phone

● PTO and Holiday Pay

● Health Benefits including Medical, vision, and dental

● T1P shirts, hats, jackets and other fun swag

● Positive, fun, respectful work environment

● Opportunities to advance internally, as we are a proud ‘promote from within’ employer

This is a full\\-time role as a W\\-2 employee of the Company and the hours will generally be 8am to 5pm Monday through Friday with an occasional need for weekend or evening work taking part in trade shows, networking events and/or industry events.

You are applying for work with a franchisee of That 1 Painter, not THAT 1 PAINTER FRANCHISING, LLC or any of its affiliates.

If hired, the franchisee will be your only employer. Franchisees are independent business owners who are solely responsible for their own employees.

Equal Opportunity Employer

Pay: $67,000\\.00 \\- $120,000\\.00 per year

* Dental insurance
* Employee discount
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Shift:

* 10 hour shift

Application Question(s):

* A client is upset about a service delay. He's speaking loudly and attracting attention.

What would you do?  
A. Acknowledge his feelings and explain how you'll try to speed things up  
B. Politely ask him to calm down and explain that getting upset won't help speed things up  
C. Explain that all clients are equally important and you're doing your best  
D. Suggest he contact the customer service hotline  
E. Direct him to speak to your supervisor

* A prospective client tells you she has used your main competitor for 10 years and likes their product.

What would you do?  
A. Ask what she would change about your competitor’s product  
B. Acknowledge the long\\-standing relationship, but tell her you should be her supplier  
C. Tell her about your product and leave a sample  
D. Highlight your competitor’s drawbacks and how your product is superior  
E. Thank her for her time and ask for referrals you can pursue

* Ahmad is working with his team when another supervisor comes up to him and says, "You should keep an eye on the incompetent people who work for you. They left a mess yesterday that my team had to clean up." Ahmad was unaware of the incident.

What should Ahmad say to her?  
A. Tell her that he'd prefer to talk about it in private later  
B. Tell her that she's being unprofessional  
C. Ask her if she has proof that his team left the mess  
D. Thank her for letting him know and promise to talk to his team  
E. Apologize for the mess on behalf of his team

title: Quantity Takeoff Technician / Estimator
description:
**About Us**:  
Pro\\-Spec Painting Corporation is entering a **Renaissance for the Next Decade**, committed to building a **high\\-performing team** that will drive us toward new growth and opportunities. This role is essential to our future, and we’re looking for someone who is comfortable with **digital tools, AI**, and eager to grow with us. If you are a **motivated, detail\\-oriented professional** who enjoys working with computers and is ready to take the next step in your career, we’d love to hear from you.

**Position Overview**:  
The **Quantity Takeoff Technician / Estimator** will be responsible for **performing precise digital takeoffs** using tools such as **Bluebeam or eTakeoff**. You’ll ensure that takeoffs align with **PDCA Cost and Estimating Guide** standards, accounting for everything from painting and wall coverings to fireproofing and lead abatement. You’ll also collaborate with estimators on budgets, project bids, and closeout processes.

**Key Responsibilities**:

* Download and review digital drawings, specifications, and project plans.
* Perform accurate takeoffs for painting, wall coverings, coatings, and related trades using **Bluebeam or eTakeoff**.
* Ensure compliance with PDCA standards for estimating.
* Use **HubSpot** for CRM tasks and managing customer interactions.
* Track budgets and estimates through **Sage 100 Contractor**.
* Collaborate with the team on submittals, change orders, and project closeout.
* Explore opportunities to integrate **AI tools** (e.g., **OpenAI, Anthropic**) to improve estimating processes.

**Qualifications**:

* **2\\-4 years of experience** in construction estimating or takeoff roles.
* Proficient with **Bluebeam** or **eTakeoff**.
* Strong understanding of construction drawings, including floor plans and sections.
* Comfortable with **Excel** and CRM tools like **HubSpot**.
* Familiarity with or willingness to learn **AI tools** such as **OpenAI** and **Anthropic’s Claude**.
* Excellent attention to detail, organizational, and communication skills.
* A desire to grow into a fully independent estimator through mentorship and training.

**Work Environment**:  
Our office is located on a quiet residential street in Vineland, NJ, providing a **comfortable and collaborative setting**. You’ll work closely with a small but ambitious team that is **embracing technology and AI** to stay ahead in the industry. At Pro\\-Spec, we believe in **learning by doing** and rewarding hard work with meaningful growth opportunities.

**Compensation \\& Benefits**:

* **Hourly Rate**: $24 \\- $26 per hour, depending on experience.
* **Bonus Potential**: Based on successful project outcomes and individual performance.

**How to Apply**:  
Please submit your **resume** and a **cover letter** explaining why this position and Pro\\-Spec Painting Corporation are the right fit for you. We will personally reply to your cover letter.

title: Pro Sales Associate - Lansdowne
description:
To thrive as a Pro Paint Specialist, you must be approachable, organized, and genuinely interested in helping our customers. Some basic computer skills are necessary to use our customer management software. An outgoing personality with a positive attitude will help you start up conversations with strangers and being a self\\-starter will be useful as well so you can jump in and help wherever you see a need. You don’t need to have any previous experience or knowledge in paint or sales. We’ll teach you everything you need to know, which makes this a perfect starting point to launch your career.


As our PPS or Pro Paint Specialist with Behr, you’ll be working in a Home Depot store as a sales specialist focusing on professional painting contractors and their unique needs. On your own and working with the Pro Desk staff, you’ll meet and form relationships with local pros who rely on Behr for excellent products and exceptional customer service. You will build relationships with pros in the store who may be there for paint but are more likely there for something else. When an outside rep sends a contractor to you for paint, you will roll out the red carpet by collaborating with them to get exactly the right products for their needs, mix the paint, collect any sundry paint tools they need and get them in and out of the store quickly so they can get back to work. You will make our professional customers feel like they had a paint store experience.


Here’s what we’re looking for from you:

* An outgoing personality. You’ll will support the Home Depot Pro Desk and introduce yourself to any contractors. Get to know them, their business, and their needs. You’ll maintain this relationship and follow up regarding their jobs and any future needs.
* Collaboration. You’ll work closely with Behr’s outside sales reps and take care of our customers when they come into the store, including pulling and tinting orders for pick up. You’ll also work closely with the Home Depot staff. We are all one team, so as their vendor you’ll be professional and helpful, working to maintain this mutually beneficial relationship.
* Basic computer skills. You’ll enter all your new leads and contacts into Salesforce, our customer relationship management tool. We can train you on this program, but all prior computer knowledge is a plus.
* Bilingual. You are not required to speak a second language, but many of our professional contractors do. If you have this knowledge, that’s definitely a bonus.


Here’s what we offer you:

* Competitive pay and bonus opportunities. Sell more gallons \\= more money!
* Accrue 15 paid days off the first year.
* 401(k) retirement plan with 4% match.
* Competitive health plans for individuals and families.
* Check out behr.com/careers to view a comprehensive list of our benefits and perks.


Founded in 1947, Behr Paint Company is one of the largest manufacturers of paints, primers, decorative finishes, stains, surface preparation, and application products for do\\-it\\-yourselfers and professionals in the United States, Canada, Mexico, China, and Chile. The Santa Ana, Calif.\\-based company and maker of the BEHR®, KILZ®, WHIZZ®, and E\\&J® brands is dedicated to meeting the project needs of DIYers, professionals, architects, and designers with an unwavering commitment to quality, innovation, and value. description:
**To thrive as a Pro Paint Specialist, you must be approachable, organized, and genuinely interested in helping our customers. Some basic computer skills are necessary to use our customer management software. An outgoing personality with a positive attitude will help you start up conversations with strangers and being a self\\-starter will be useful as well so you can jump in and help wherever you see a need. You don’t need to have any previous experience or knowledge in paint or sales. We’ll teach you everything you need to know, which makes this a perfect starting point to launch your career.**
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------


As our PPS or Pro Paint Specialist with Behr, you’ll be working in a Home Depot store as a sales specialist focusing on professional painting contractors and their unique needs. On your own and working with the Pro Desk staff, you’ll meet and form relationships with local pros who rely on Behr for excellent products and exceptional customer service. You will build relationships with pros in the store who may be there for paint but are more likely there for something else. When an outside rep sends a contractor to you for paint, you will roll out the red carpet by collaborating with them to get exactly the right products for their needs, mix the paint, collect any sundry paint tools they need and get them in and out of the store quickly so they can get back to work. You will make our professional customers feel like they had a paint store experience.

**Here’s what we’re looking for from you:**

* An outgoing personality. You’ll will support the Home Depot Pro Desk and introduce yourself to any contractors. Get to know them, their business, and their needs. You’ll maintain this relationship and follow up regarding their jobs and any future needs.
* Collaboration. You’ll work closely with Behr’s outside sales reps and take care of our customers when they come into the store, including pulling and tinting orders for pick up. You’ll also work closely with the Home Depot staff. We are all one team, so as their vendor you’ll be professional and helpful, working to maintain this mutually beneficial relationship.
* Basic computer skills. You’ll enter all your new leads and contacts into Salesforce, our customer relationship management tool. We can train you on this program, but all prior computer knowledge is a plus.
* Bilingual. You are not required to speak a second language, but many of our professional contractors do. If you have this knowledge, that’s definitely a bonus.

**Here’s what we offer you:**

* Competitive pay and bonus opportunities. Sell more gallons \\= more money!
* Accrue 15 paid days off the first year.

title: Sales Estimator
description:
Do you have a knack for connecting with customers and building quality relationships with them quickly? Does the idea of being in the field and visiting prospective job sites sound appealing? If you’re excited about helping people, providing solutions, and closing the sale, we want to speak with you immediately!

  

Five Star Painting is hiring a Sales Estimator in the Austin area. As a valued team member, you’ll follow up on leads, provide accurate estimates to potential customers, and close the deal so our team can refresh their property with new paint.

  

We provide you with the leads – you just need to nurture them to close. We’ve seen time and again that the best estimators are those that take the time to build a relationship with the customer. When you follow our process at Five Star Painting, you’ll successfully close new opportunities while working outside the office and controlling your income.

  

This position is commission based, so being comfortable with knowing that you’re responsible for your own income is critical to finding success in this role.

 **Why You’ll Want to Join Our Team**


As a Sales Estimator, you’ll enjoy the freedom of working with our customers on location – no stuffy offices to sit in all day.


Because of our strong reputation in the community, you can trust that our customers will be happy to see you. This isn’t the cold\\-call selling you may be used to. We provide you with the leads, and you meet with the customers.


Our team is committed to your training and your success.

 **Responsibilities of a Sales Estimator**


As part of your sales activity, you’ll also be estimating jobs. You’ll be responsible for the following activities to succeed in this role:

* Meet with customers to listen and understand their needs.
* Accurately measure and estimate the cost of the job and confirm the services and materials that are needed.
* Clearly communicate expectations to customers.
* Accurately document and create written proposals.
* Schedule color consultations.
* Follow up with prospective clients.
* Support the marketing efforts by promoting Five Star Painting.
* Self\\-generate additional referrals from existing customers and new leads.
* Close new business to support revenue growth.

 **Requirements to be Successful**


From day one, we want you to find success as a Sales Estimator. That’s why we generate the leads and train you on how to estimate and close them.


Our most successful reps have the following traits. If this sounds like you, apply today!

* Ability to have a positive attitude that won’t let a “no” from a customer get you down.
* Organized, detail\\-oriented and strive to deliver extremely accurate estimates.
* Take pride in your effective communication skills when working with strangers.
* Maintain professional appearance and attitude when selling to customers.
* Team player who can also work independently if necessary.
* Reliable transportation to the office and our customers’ properties.
* Prior experience in home service sales is a plus.

 **Benefits**


The pay for this position is 100% commission after 90 days of training. You’re able to set your own income depending on your ability to accurately estimate and close customer deals.

  

Should you meet the requirements for the position, our system will schedule you for an interview immediately.

title: Painter
description:
**Job Overview**  
We are seeking a skilled Painter to join our team. The ideal candidate will have experience in various painting techniques and a strong understanding of construction\\-related tasks. This role involves working on residential and commercial projects, ensuring high\\-quality finishes and adherence to safety standards. The Painter will be responsible for preparing surfaces, applying paint, and maintaining tools and equipment.

**Responsibilities**

* Prepare surfaces for painting by cleaning, sanding, and filling holes or cracks.
* Apply paint, varnish, or other finishes using brushes, rollers, or spray equipment.
* Ensure proper mixing of paints and materials to achieve desired colors and textures.
* Maintain a clean and organized work area on the construction site.
* Collaborate with other tradespeople to complete projects efficiently.
* Perform touch\\-ups and repairs as needed to ensure quality finishes.
* Follow safety protocols to minimize hazards on the job site.
* Maintain tools and equipment in good working condition.
* Ability to lift 50\\-75 lbs, prolonged standing some squatting stooping and kneeling, climbing .
* Must be to pass a drug screen.
* Job specific certifications are a plus.

**Skills**

* Proficient at drywall techniques, patching ,mud and sanding.
* Proficient in construction painting techniques with a focus on residential painting.
* Knowledge of stucco application and concrete finishing is preferred.
* Ability to use hand tools effectively for various tasks including trim carpentry.
* Basic math skills for measuring areas and calculating paint quantities.
* Experience working on construction sites with an understanding of safety practices.
* Strong attention to detail and commitment to delivering high\\-quality work.
* Ability to work independently as well as part of a team.

Join us in creating beautiful spaces through your craftsmanship!

Job Types: Full\\-time, Part\\-time

Pay: $23\\.50 \\- $25\\.75 per hour

Expected hours: 40 per week

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift

People with a criminal record are encouraged to apply
