title: Painter and Painting Subcontractor
description:
**Join Our Growing Painting Team in Northeast Tarrant County!**

WOW 1 DAY PAINTING is a leading residential and commercial painting company, and we're expanding our operations in Northeast Tarrant County. We're currently seeking skilled painters to join our team, with opportunities for growth into leadership roles, including Project Manager.

**Are you passionate about your work and ready to be part of an outstanding painting company?** Do you take pride in delivering exceptional service and making customers say "WOW"? We're looking for friendly and proficient painters who can provide on\\-time service while WOWing our customers. At WOW 1 DAY PAINTING, we're dedicated to helping our team members realize their full potential.

**The Opportunity**

As a painter with WOW 1 DAY PAINTING, you will:

* Perform interior and exterior painting jobs
* Impress residential and commercial customers with your professionalism and exceptional communication skills
* Proudly represent our brand as a friendly and uniformed painter
* Participate in team events and celebrate individual, team, and company successes
* Safely work on step ladders and extension ladders (heights aren’t a problem for you, right?)
* Efficiently prepare, paint, and clean up jobs with great attention to detail
* Maintain open availability to work
* Embrace a "How can I help you?" attitude

**Does this sound like you?**

You're an energetic, hard\\-working, and responsible team player who thrives in a fun and challenging environment. You take pride in your work and have a proven track record of providing exceptional customer service. Your painting skills include prep work, masking, good brush/rolling technique, and spray experience. With a positive attitude, you're committed to doing things right and making customers happy. You're eager to learn and develop valuable skills in various work environments and you're driven to achieve goals and meet deadlines.

**Opportunities for Growth:**

We are looking for painters who not only excel in their craft but also have the potential to grow into leadership positions within our company, including Project Manager. While we're not hiring directly into the Project Manager role, we are actively seeking individuals who demonstrate the leadership qualities, responsibility, and work ethic that make them ideal candidates for future promotions.

**Qualifications for this Position:**

We're seeking someone who can not only deliver a great paint job but also create an exceptional experience for our customers. If you have the ambition and drive to advance your career, this could be the perfect opportunity for you.

**Sounds like an amazing opportunity, doesn't it?** Well, there's more! Wages range based on experience and competency, and we offer plenty of opportunities for career development, increased earnings, and advancement within our company as you prove yourself.

At WOW 1 DAY PAINTING, we're revolutionizing the painting industry by delivering the quality our customers expect in a timeline that is unexpected. If you're ready to be part of something bigger and build your career with an exciting company, apply now and let us know why this is the job for you!

* 8 hour shift
* Monday to Friday

title: Project Coordinator
description:
**GROW YOUR LEADERSHIP SKILLS AS A PROJECT MANAGER!**

Are you looking for a career with large growth opportunities? Do you enjoy working and leading people? If so, this could be for you!

**COMPANY**

Spray Tex Painting is a leader in the residential home painting market in the Dallas\\-Fort Worth Metroplex. We specialize in high\\-end residential painting services, and our team members take great pride in the work we do. We think of ourselves are much more than a Painting company, our ultimate intention is to create and empower trusted partnerships. Spray Tex Painting has a passion for growth, dedication to employees and commitment to client satisfaction. Our company core values are Integrity, Transparency, Growth and Responsibility. Spray Tex is a close group of high performers. There is an open collaborative culture, and emphasis on employee and customer feedback. You can expect positive changes frequently as we continuously improve our systems and grow. Spray Tex believes in creating opportunities for high performers to elevate in both their career and in their personal development.

**JOB SUMMARY**

The purpose of this position is to manage painting projects from the **hand\\-off from the sales person to job completion**. The key objective is to create a trusted partnership with our client and provide world class service. The Project Manager will oversee several active projects/week in multiple locations and will be responsible for planning/preparing projects for future weeks. Up to 50% travel is required within the DFW Metroplex. The Project Manager will be self\\-motivated, direct fast\\-moving teams and enjoy the camaraderie of a rapidly\\-growing company. This position will take full ownership of his/her assigned projects to ensure projects are completed in a timely fashion, within the allocated budget and meet client expectations. Our Project Managers are the lifeblood of our company and can make/break a client’s experience. The Project Manager is pivotal in the success of our public image and well as responsible for coordinating the delivery of our painting services.

We will equip you with the tools to be successful, how you implement them depends upon you!

**ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES**

* Strong business ethics, integrity and ability to perform in a highly autonomous environment. Dependable, reliable and time sensitive.
* Effectively manages projects from sales person hand\\-off to completion while tracking and optimizing scheduling, labor, subcontractors, budgeting, materials costs, communications and job quality. Performs all contracted scopes per company policies and procedures.
* Interfaces directly with clients to define project requirements provided by sales person. Prepares scope of work, project delivery resource requirements, work plan schedule, milestones and quality control.
* Leads project delivery resources/team providing project guidance and direction to achieve project goals. Ensures all work is properly subcontracted. Manages subcontractors. Monitors work throughout the project. Drives safety, quality and productivity in the field.
* Implements project documentation governance aligned with company and client requirements. Ensures project data integrity and documentation is accurate, timely and coordinated.
* Implements communication plan to keep client and project resources informed. Ensures the highest level of client communication and client service.
* Tracks progress of each project against goals, objectives, approved budgets and approved timelines. Reports status and variances. Creates plans to meet objectives, budget and schedule.
* A road warrior who can strongly manage multiple projects simultaneously and determine fair payments with subcontractors.
* Implements change management routines to access change requests, make recommendations, secure client approvals and issue change orders. Assesses change requests to determine impacts to scope, budget, schedule and quality.
* Demonstrates ability to identify project risks, develop risk mitigation and contingency plans and implements action plans to reduce or eliminate project risks.
* Other duties as required.

**QUALIFICATIONS**

* Bachelor’s Degree preferred; Associate’s Degree required
* Prior experience in painting, construction of similar industry preferred
* English required; Spanish preferred
* 5 years customer service experience required
* 5 years crew management experience required
* Experience in managing projects
* Ability to read, understand and apply standards to moderately complex documents including but not limited to agreements/contracts, forms, process flows and reports
* Ability to travel up to 50% of the time
* Reliable transportation

**COMMUNICATION SKILLS**

* Excellent written and verbal communication skills
* Strong organizational and analytical skills
* Responsive to incoming communications in a timely manner
* Ability to provide efficient, reliable and courteous service to clients
* Ability to effectively present information
* Skilled in managing difficult situations and solving problems
* Effective in leading teams under pressure and through challenging situations

**OTHER SKILLS AND ABILITIES**

* Intermediate computer skills.
* Ability to effectively utilize our proprietary software program and other software programs.
* Skilled with using smartphone (calls, texting, calendar, Zoom) for client and business communications.
* Effective use of email.

**SCOPE OF RESPONSIBILITY**

Decisions made with thorough understanding of procedures, company policies and business practices to achieve general results and deadlines. Responsible for setting work unit and/or project deadlines. Errors in judgment may cause short\\-term impact to department.

**BENEFITS**

* Medical benefits
* 2% 401k matching program
* Paid time off and holidays available as established by company policy
* Smartphone and tablet provided
* Company attire provided (shirts, jacket, name badges, cap)

Benefit Conditions:

* Waiting period may apply
* Only full\\-time employees eligible

This Job Is Ideal for Someone Who Is:

* Dependable \\-\\- more reliable than spontaneous
* People\\-oriented \\-\\- enjoys interacting with people and working on group projects
* Detail\\-oriented \\-\\- would rather focus on the details of work than the bigger picture

**We thank everyone that applies, however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted. Thank you \\& good luck!** 

Job Type: Full\\-time

Pay: $72,000\\.00 \\- $100,000\\.00 per year

Benefits:

* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Retirement plan

Compensation Package:

* Bonus opportunities
* Weekly pay

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Monday to Friday

Application Question(s):

* If you had to sum up project management into one word what would it be?

Experience:

* Customer service: 5 years (Required)
* Management: 5 years (Required)

Language:

* English (Required)
* Spanish (Preferred)

Work Location: On the road

description:
We are looking for a self\\-motivated, Territory Operations Manger with a passion for sales and growing the business. The day to day in this role includes meeting with prospective clients within your assigned territory through pre scheduled appointments, discussing our products and services and putting together sales estimates. We offer our customers a 100% satisfaction guarantee. We need people who share this philosophy and can maintain a long\\-term focus on building lasting relationships and a positive reputation.

Manage the sales flow for all in bound leads and closing on sales opportunities, following up when necessary.

Coordinating daily with customer and crew.

Provide excellent customer service, communication, organization and leadership skills.

Initiate lead generation programs.

Attend networking events.

Perform field visits to ensure high quality work and customer satisfactions.

Complete necessary administrative paper work and duties.

Comply with data integrity and security policies.

Attend Daily \\& weekly review meetings with Owners as scheduled.

The ideal candidates for this position is someone who has an eye for detail as well as strong work ethic that always shows forward momentum.

2\\+ years of Sales experience in Painting services or in a home improvement business.

Energetic, self starter with a strong background in customer engagement.

Also includes working in cramped spaces, on ladders and with power tools and perform manual labor in outside environment, exposed to heat, sun, high humidity, rain and other adverse weather conditions.

description:
Alliance Garage Floors is a growing home service business focused on residential painting and concrete coating. With 5 star ratings on Google we are focused on meeting the needs of homeowners helping make their dreams a reality.

title: Craftsman
description:
**Level 3\\. Craftsman**
**The Role**  

As a Craftsman, you will join Painters USA and gain valuable knowledge. A successful Craftsman is: punctual, organized, communicates successfully, receives coaching well, detail oriented, and a team player. Additionally, you should have a strong work ethic and exhibit our company culture and values.
**Responsibilities and Duties**  

The Craftsman should have a minimum of 1\\-year industry experience, have excellent safety knowledge \\& awareness along with essential technical skills according to your job area. As a Craftsman, you may require some ongoing skills training and minimal on\\-site supervision of job\\-related tasks. You will able to perform according to company safety and quality standards with no violations and should meet the "Medium Standard" rate of production speed.
**Skills and Education**
* High school education preferred
* 1 year industry experience required
* Strong attention to detail
* Ability to multitask and remain organized
* Proactive worker and problem solver

**Work Environment**  

This job may require lifting of up to 25 lbs., bending, and kneeling for extending period of time. It may also require the use of power tools and heavy machinery. The use of a ladder may be involved.
**Our Company**  

Painters USA was founded in 1976 and has since grown into a thriving, highly respected company, serving industrial and commercial clients across the United States. Our project crews and office staff are invested and dedicated employees working from offices in Texas and Illinois. Painters USA is proud to be WBENC\\-certified as a woman\\-owned business enterprise.
Our **Mission** is to enhance the community and the lives of our employees, clients, and vendors, one brush stroke at a time.
Our **Vision** is to be the nation's leading provider of industrial and commercial painting \\& coating services.
At Painters USA, our company **values** are instilled in every employee at every level from day one. From our field technicians proudly displaying them on their shirts to posters on our office walls, all employees are reminded to project and promote these values in everything they do.
**P**erformance  

**A**ccountability  

**I**ntegrity  

**N**ever sacrifice safety  

**T**eam work  

**E**mpowerment  

**R**especting God and each other
**EEO Statement**  

Painters USA provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.
This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.

title: (G3) Outside Sales / Business Development Specialist (Merced Areas)
description:
**Lancaster Painting** of **Turlock, CA** is currently hiring for a motivated **Outside Sales / Business Development Specialist** to provide excellent customer service, network, and sell residential services to homeowners and property managers or owners. This position can earn **$130,000** at minimum goal with an opportunity to earn more! Base salary \\+ commission. Compensation will be performance\\-driven along with a base salary depending on experience. There is also commission and a monthly bonus potential that can take total compensation well into the 6\\-figure range.


As an **Outside Sales / Business Development Specialist**, you will be the driving force behind expanding our market presence by prospecting new customers and nurturing community connections. This role is **perfect for someone involved in networking organizations** like the Chamber of Commerce, Rotary Club, or other community groups, and who thrives in building lasting business relationships.


At Lancaster Painting, we're not just about paint; we're about building relationships and leaving lasting impressions. If you excel at developing new business opportunities, have exceptional networking skills, and know how to close deals, we want to hear from you!

**ABOUT LANCASTER PAINTING**


Lancaster Painting is the number one spot for commercial and residential paint jobs. We don't treat painting like a side gig or just a way to earn a few extra bucks in our spare time. We provide a friendly yet professional touch for every job we're called on for. And, thanks to our 30\\+ years of experience, dedicated Project Leaders, and exceptionally high\\-quality paint and concrete coating solutions we have scored an excellent reputation in our community.


Every painter and flooring technician on our team is a **verified professional who we personally know and trust**. Our team shares the same belief that our client's family home deserves the best, which is why we provide **amazing pay and benefits**!


In addition to **great pay** and our **excellent culture**, we offer our **Outside Sales / Business Development Specialist** the following benefits and perks:

* **Paid time off (PTO)**
* **Medical benefits**
* **A 401(k) plan**
* **A monthly bonus program**
* **A company vehicle**
* **Training programs and dedicated Sales Coach**
* **Room for growth**

**KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:**

* **Prospecting \\& Networking**: Actively seek new leads and build relationships through community involvement (e.g., Chamber of Commerce, Rotary Club).
* **Sales \\& Estimating**: Provide personalized consultations, create accurate estimates, and follow up on leads to close deals.
* **Client Management**: Maintain and grow existing client relationships, while developing new business opportunities.
* **Collaboration**: Work closely with project leaders to ensure successful project handoffs and execution.
* **Reporting \\& Goals**: Regularly report on sales activity and ensure sales goals are met, addressing shortfalls with actionable plans.

 **OUR IDEAL OUTSIDE SALES / NETWORKING SPECIALIST**

* Previous sales experience in home improvement, painting, or related industries.
* Strong community involvement, with a history of networking through local organizations (e.g., Chamber of Commerce, Rotary Club).
* Exceptional communication, problem\\-solving, and negotiation skills.
* Valid driver's license and clean driving record.

 **REQUIREMENTS**


As an Outside Sales / Business Development Specialist, you effectively sell residential services to homeowners and property managers or owners. You make calls, send emails, and respond to customers in a professional and timely manner. While identifying opportunities to increase sales performance, you develop business, generate new leads, and participate in community building or networking activities. You travel within the sales region to meet prospects or customers while always maintaining our professional company image. You keep track of records, establish customer relationships, and assist with any other business development tasks as needed. **You feel good about using your networking skills to build our presence in the community and increase our business!**

* 2\\+ years of outside sales experience
* Willing to dedicate 40 \\- 50 hours each week to this position
* Computer experience, especially with Microsoft Office Suite, Google Mail, Google Calendars, etc.


Industry knowledge or a college degree is a plus! Are you self\\-motivated and driven by deadlines and results? Can you work with minimal direction? Do you have excellent communication and people skills? Are you willing to provide world\\-class service? Can you play an active role within a dynamic, competitive team? If yes, give us the chance to review your information.

 **ARE YOU READY?**

title: (I1) Carpenter
description:
**Lancaster Painting**, located in Turlock, CA, is currently in search of a dependable full\\-time Carpenter to specialize in drywall, fascia, and siding repairs for home remodels. If you're a seasoned carpentry or construction professional seeking a company that values and promotes a fantastic workplace culture rooted in family values and work\\-life balance, then we want to hear from you. Are you dedicated to delivering quality craftsmanship and eager to thrive in a supportive environment? Discover more about this opportunity by continuing to read!

  

This full\\-time carpentry position works a **typical Monday \\- Friday, 7:30 am \\- 4:00 pm** and earns **competitive pay** of **$25 \\- $35 per hour depending on experience**, with the **opportunity to earn bonuses**. We provide **amazing benefits and perks**, including **medical benefits, a 401(k), paid time off (PTO), and a monthly bonus program**. Additionally, we offer our carpenters **training programs for growth and advancement**. If this sounds like the right **construction opportunity** for you, **apply today**!

 **ABOUT LANCASTER PAINTING**


Lancaster Painting is the number one spot for commercial and residential paint jobs. We don't treat painting like a side gig or just a way to earn a few extra bucks in our spare time. We provide a friendly yet professional touch for every job we're called on for. And, thanks to our 30\\+ years of experience, dedicated Project Leaders, and exceptionally high\\-quality paint and concrete coating solutions we have scored an excellent reputation in our community.


Every painter and flooring technician on our team is a **verified professional who we personally know and trust**. Our team shares the same belief that our client's family home deserves the best, which is why we provide **amazing pay and benefits**!

 **CARPENTER QUALIFICATIONS**


Do you have the ability to plan and manage your schedule 2\\-3 weeks out? Are you an excellent problem solver? Do you take pride in the quality of your skilled trade skills? Are you self\\-motivated and goal\\-oriented? Do you have the desire to work with a construction company that values you? If yes, we need you on our carpentry team!

 **ARE YOU READY TO JOIN OUR SKILLED TRADE TEAM?**


If you feel you'll be perfect as our full\\-time Carpenter, **apply now** using our initial **3\\-minute, mobile\\-friendly application.**

title: Experienced Painter
description:
Welcome to **Bowman Painting**, where craftsmanship meets creativity! Are you ready to brush up on your career? Located in the vibrant community of Ormond Beach, FL, we're seeking **Experienced Painters** to join our team **full\\-time**.

 **WHY SHOULD YOU JOIN US?**


Bowman Painting offers more than just a job; we provide a canvas for your professional growth. With a **competitive wage of $18 \\- $21 per hour**, plus **time and a half for overtime hours**, and a drug free workplace, your hard work will be rewarded. We also provide our paint crew with **amazing benefits**, including paid time off (PTO), monthly bonus incentives, training and education, upward mobility, and offers health insurance and Colonial Life supplemental insurance for accident, cancer, dental, and vision.


Our paint crew also enjoys a Monday to Friday schedule, typically starting at 7 am to 8 am and ending at 3:30 pm to 5:30 pm, with occasional Saturdays.


Wondering how you can enjoy this amazing compensation and benefits package? All that you need to become our Experienced Painter is:

* 1 year of painting experience
* Physical ability to safely navigate the Florida heat and humidity, ladders, and scaffolding
* Valid driver's license with reliable transportation


Spraying experience would be a plus!

 **ABOUT BOWMAN PAINTING**


We are experts in all things painting, providing an array of services, including indoor \\& outdoor residential repaints, commercial new construction, and renovations in Central Florida. As a BBB\\-accredited company and proud members of the Painting Contractors of America (PCA), we desire to promote the coating industry by adhering to all PCA standards and ethics. We work to benefit our community and our national trade organization with high\\-quality craftsmanship. Our mission is to glorify God by providing our clients with exceptional service with friendliness, diligence, dependability, and fine craftsmanship.


We desire to build a company where its employees can take pride in their skills and learn new ones. Our team members enthusiastically push one another to greater heights and exemplify our core values of integrity, excellence, growth \\& learning, reliability, and respect. We also provide our employees with **great pay, work\\-life balance**, and a **positive atmosphere**!

 **COME ADVANCE YOUR PAINTING CAREER WITH US!**


As an Experienced Painter, you are involved in all facets of the job including, caulking, spackling, sanding, masking, rolling, brushing, spray application, and pressure washing. If this sounds like the perfect fit for you, apply today with our initial 3\\-minute, mobile\\-friendly application. Apply now and let your career flourish with us!

title: Office Manager
description:
**About Us**  
A Classic Touch Painting is the premier residential and commercial painting company in Volusia County, dedicated to providing top\\-quality service and craftsmanship. We pride ourselves on service, integrity, and attention to detail. As we continue to grow, we are seeking an organized and dedicated Office Manager to oversee day\\-to\\-day operations and support our team in delivering exceptional results for our customers.

**Position Overview**  
The Office Manager will play a crucial role in the smooth operation of our business. This person will manage customer communications, handle scheduling and dispatching, coordinate with field technicians, and ensure all administrative functions run efficiently. The ideal candidate will have strong organizational skills, experience in office management, and the ability to support and lead an office team.

**Duties**

* Manage day\\-to\\-day office operations, ensuring a productive work environment.
* Manage all customer communications, ensuring timely and professional responses to inquiries, appointments, and follow\\-ups.
* Oversee scheduling and dispatching of field technicians for residential and commercial projects.
* Coordinate material orders to ensure timely delivery and job readiness.
* Assist with fleet management, including scheduling routine maintenance and resolving any issues that arise with company vehicles.
* Support field technicians by providing necessary administrative assistance, including tracking job progress and coordinating with the project team.
* Manage office staff responsible for administrative tasks related to project coordination, billing, and vendor management.
* Maintain and organize office records, databases, and project files to ensure accuracy and easy accessibility.
* Collaborate with other departments and leaders to streamline office processes and improve operational efficiency.
* Oversee the implementation and use of office technology systems and ensure they meet the company’s needs.
* Ensure compliance with company policies and industry regulations.
* Maintain organized filing systems for both physical and digital documents.
* Assist in budgeting processes, tracking expenses, and ensuring adherence to financial guidelines.
* Implement and maintain office policies and procedures to enhance operational efficiency.
* Utilize QuickBooks for financial tracking and reporting as needed.
* Support medical office management tasks, if applicable, ensuring compliance with relevant regulations.
* Provide administrative support to senior management as required.

**Qualifications**

* Proven experience as an Office Manager or in a similar administrative role, ideally within the home services or construction industry.
* Excellent organizational and multitasking abilities.
* Strong communication and interpersonal skills for dealing with customers, vendors, and team members.
* Proficient in office software (e.g., MS Office, scheduling software).
* Experience in managing a team or coordinating with multiple departments is a plus.
* Ability to prioritize tasks and solve problems efficiently in a fast\\-paced environment.
* Proficient in QuickBooks and other office management software.
* Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal.
* Ability to work independently as well as part of a team.
* Attention to detail and problem\\-solving abilities are essential.

We look forward to welcoming a dedicated Office Manager who is ready to contribute positively to our team. Join us in shaping the future of A Classic Touch Painting!

Job Type: Full\\-time

Pay: $50,000\\.00 \\- $60,000\\.00 per year

* Employee discount
* Paid time off

title: Marketing Manager
description:
The Marketing Manager is a key role in our family of companies serving the home service industry in Central Ohio. This role will develop and manage all aspects of our marketing strategy – in both the parent company (Final Touch Painting), as well as several sister companies (Revamp Electric in Delaware, OH and Breeze Brothers, Hilliard, OH). In addition, the parent company has plans to eventually expand into multiple locations. This role is ideal for a self\\-starter excited to build a high performing team and see their contributions rewarded.


This role will focus on creating, implementing, tracking and optimizing our digital and traditional marketing campaigns across various marketing channels. This position requires strong skills in data analytics, expert experience in digital platforms, excellent communication skills and strong attention to detail. The ultimate goals of this role are to 1\\) drive re\\-engagement with past customers. 2\\) drive engagement with potential new customers. **In summary, generating quality leads for each of the businesses is the core KPI.**

 **ABOUT THE JOB \\- KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:**


Required:

* 3\\+ years of experience **with a proven track record of generating leads and analyzing ROI**
* Experience with marketing efforts centered on Business to Customer.
* Team Player who enjoys collaboration, with excellent communication and interpersonal skills
* Excellent organizational and time management skills
* Experience with CRM and SEO tools including: (GO High Level, preferred; Wordpress; Google Analytics; Google Adwords, other CRM softwares)
* Proficient in the use of the following social media platforms both paid and organic: (Facebook, Instagram; Tik Tok)
* Proficient in Microsoft Office \\& Google Workspace

  

Preferred:

* Agency experience preferred
* Home Service Business Experience
* Degree in Marketing
* Management Experience

  

Ongoing Responsibilities:

* Collaborate with the Leadership Team to set marketing goals and objectives
* Design and improve present marketing campaigns to ensure they are hitting our target markets
* Coordinate with vendors and suppliers on marketing\\-related activities
* Negotiate compensation and project details for outside contractors related to marketing and promotions
* Management of PPC ad spend (in conjunction with vendors)


	+ AdWords \\& PPC
	+ Google Local Service Ads
	+ Facebook Ads \\& other social media platforms
* Use data and reports to track marketing channels’ ROI and make evidence\\-based decisions
* Communicate and share new marketing strategies as developments occur in technology and social media platforms
* Plan and attend home shows and community events
* Monthly job site visits to capture visual assets used in before/after promotions, client testimonials, and videos of five star staff in action.

  

Weekly Deliverables:

* Lead and release new social media content on all platforms
* Actively participate in weekly Team Sales Meetings, prepared to contribute
* Monitor and analyze sales/marketing metrics to assess performance
* Optimize all marketing channels and manage their respective budgets
* Communicate proactively with marketing vendors and partners
* Lead and develop new marketing creatives and ensure high quality work from all vendors

  

Monthly Deliverables:

* Prepare and deliver Monthly Marketing Reports to for each business to key stakeholders.
* Review financial reports regarding Marketing spend and ROI

  

SCHEDULE

* 8\\-5 Mon – Fri at our office (Delaware, OH)
* Some evenings with Community Events and Home Shows (1\\-2x month in summer)

title: Sales Estimator
description:
Do you have a knack for connecting with customers and building quality relationships with them quickly? Does the idea of being in the field and visiting prospective job sites sound appealing? If you’re excited about helping people, providing solutions, and closing the sale, we want to speak with you immediately!

  

Five Star Painting is hiring a Sales Estimator in our area. As a valued team member, you’ll follow up on leads, provide accurate estimates to potential customers, and close the deal so our team can refresh their property with new paint.

  

We provide you with the leads – you just need to nurture them to close. We’ve seen time and again that the best estimators are those that take the time to build a relationship with the customer. When you follow our process at Five Star Painting, you’ll successfully close new opportunities while working outside the office and controlling your income.

  

This position is commission based, so being comfortable with knowing that you’re responsible for your own income is critical to finding success in this role.

 **Why You’ll Want to Join Our Team**


As a Sales Estimator, you’ll enjoy the freedom of working with our customers on location – no stuffy offices to sit in all day.


Because of our strong reputation in the community, you can trust that our customers will be happy to see you. This isn’t the cold\\-call selling you may be used to. We provide you with the leads, and you meet with the customers.


Our team is committed to your training and your success.

 **Responsibilities of a Sales Estimator**


As part of your sales activity, you’ll also be estimating jobs. You’ll be responsible for the following activities to succeed in this role:

* Meet with customers to listen and understand their needs.
* Accurately measure and estimate the cost of the job and confirm the services and materials that are needed.
* Clearly communicate expectations to customers.
* Accurately document and create written proposals.
* Schedule color consultations.
* Follow up with prospective clients.
* Support the marketing efforts by promoting Five Star Painting.
* Self\\-generate additional referrals from existing customers and new leads.
* Close new business to support revenue growth.

 **Requirements to be Successful**


From day one, we want you to find success as a Sales Estimator. That’s why we generate the leads and train you on how to estimate and close them.


Our most successful reps have the following traits. If this sounds like you, apply today!

* Ability to have a positive attitude that won’t let a “no” from a customer get you down.
* Organized, detail\\-oriented and strive to deliver extremely accurate estimates.
* Take pride in your effective communication skills when working with strangers.
* Maintain professional appearance and attitude when selling to customers.
* Team player who can also work independently if necessary.
* Reliable transportation to the office and our customers’ properties.
* Prior experience in home service sales is a plus.

 **Benefits**


The pay for this position is 100% commission after 90 days of training. You’re able to set your own income depending on your ability to accurately estimate and close customer deals.

  

Estimated Annual Compensation: $40,000\\-$100,000/year

  

Remember, we’re looking to hire only the best. If that’s you, APPLY TODAY!

title: Professional Painter
description:
We're not your run\\-of\\-the\\-mill professional painting company. We're a dedicated team tackling everything from decks and framing to drywall, paint, and every meticulous detail in between. If you're experienced and enthusiastic about contributing to something exceptional, we want YOU!

**About us**

Paintworks Unlimited Contracting Co. LLC is a small business in Fayetteville, NC. We are professional, agile and nimble.

We're looking for a Professional Painter to join our team. The right person for this position will be able to lift heavy objects and have relevant experience in the trade. The right individual will have experience in all aspects of residential \\& commercial painting.

Who We Are: We're not your run\\-of\\-the\\-mill construction crew. We're a dedicated team tackling everything from decks and framing to drywall, paint, and every meticulous detail in between. If you're experienced and enthusiastic about contributing to something exceptional, we want YOU!

What We Need: An experienced, motivated individual ready to dive into the challenges of residential \\& commercial painting.

Responsibilities:

* Work outdoors.
* Use hands to perform work duties.
* Have your own basic hand tools.
* Lift, carry, push, pull, or otherwise move objects.
* Bend at the waist.
* Climb ladders.
* Clear debris from construction sites and maintain cleanliness of area.
* Assist other team members with lifting, climbing, and carrying duties.
* Select appropriate paints and finishes based on the project requirements
* Perform touch\\-ups and ensure quality finishes

Preferred Skills: Proficient in caulking and residential \\& commercial painting prep and techniques plus knowledge of color theory is preferred.

What You'll Gain:

* A chance to be an essential part of a cohesive team valuing your expertise.
* Opportunities for professional growth within the painting \\& light construction domain.
* Competitive compensation and the fulfillment of contributing to the creation of dream homes!

Join us on this rewarding journey of transforming blueprints into stunning homes. Apply now and let's create something extraordinary together!

title: Business Development Manager
description:
That 1 Painter is the fastest growing painting company in the nation offering a wide range of 18 different service options. Our unwavering commitment to exceptional workmanship ensures the highest quality outcomes, creating not just stunning results but also great satisfaction. Our Brand Promise is to be The Best House Guest Ever. If you possess a passion for delivering unparalleled customer service and desire to be part of a company with a remarkable culture, we look forward to meeting you!

We are seeking a dynamic and experienced business development manager to join our team and help lead the continued growth of That 1 Painter within the Piedmont Triad market. The Business Development Manager will play a pivotal role in establishing and managing referral relationships with allied industry partners and driving sales. Experience working in a B2B development capacity will be critical, including among general contractors, architects, interior designers, real estate brokers, and other home service professionals (e.g. roofing, restoration, HVAC, plumbing and electrical contractors).

Responsibilities:

Sales Management: Collaborate with our regional director andproject managers to develop and execute volume\\-based sales strategies to drive revenue growth within the region. Monitor and analyze sales performance, identifying areas for improvement and implementing corrective measures as needed. title: Painter
description:
***TEXT PAINTER TO 704\\-850\\-9952 TO APPLY***
---------------------------------------------


**GENERAL STATEMENT OF JOB**


Responsible for use paint application techniques and equipment to professionally finish interior and exterior surfaces.


**SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIES**


* None


**ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS**

* Measures area to be painted; determines quantity and type of paint to use for the project.
* Identifies and orders appropriate paint colors and finishes, mixing if needed.
* Prepares surfaces to be painted, which may include removing prior finishes through chemicals, grit blast, or other methods.
* Masks, removes, covers, or otherwise protects furniture, hardware, trim, and other nonpainted surfaces.
* Applies paint to interior and exterior surfaces using brushes, rollers, sprayers, airbrushes, stencils, and other tools.
* Performs basic stencil and line work, which may include painting lines on factory floors, parking lots, and other surfaces.
* Complies with chemical and waste storage and disposal regulations and best practices.
* Builds scaffolding according to safety regulations.
* Maintains a clean work area.
* Ability to follow instructions and provide consistent work.
* Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail
* Performs other duties as assigned.


**EDUCATION, EXPERIENCE AND TRAINING**


* Completion of a formal apprenticeship program, previous experience, or on\\-the\\-job training required.
* Motivated and works well with others.
* OSHA30 preferred.
* Willingness to embrace change in a growing company


**STANDARDS OF PERFORMANCE**


* Demonstrate informative and professional assistance when working with customers, vendors, and team members.
* Act independently and originate new approaches to problems.
* Maintain initiative to preserve the flow of work.
* Work under stress with commitment to deadlines.
* Sustain interpersonal relationships, which encourage openness, candor, and trust, both internally and externally.
* Complete tasks in an accurate and timely manner.
* Maintain Company information in a confidential manner.


**MENTAL AND PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS**


* The physical activities described are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodation may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions and expectations.
* Individuals may need to ride or drive in a vehicle for 2 or more hours at a time depending on position.
* Individuals working at an outside job site may be exposed to varying temperatures including very hot (above 90 degrees F) or very cold (below 32 degrees F) and all\\-weather conditions.
* Individuals may be exposed to cramped workspaces, contaminants, extremely bright or inadequate lighting conditions, exposure to sounds and noise levels that are distracting or uncomfortable.
* Performing this job requires frequent use of hands to handle, control or feel objects, tools, or controls. Must be able to sit, talk, hear, and stand frequently throughout the day. Must be able to climb, reach above shoulder height, stoop, kneel, crouch or crawl frequently.
* The position occasionally may require lifting heavy objects (up to 75 pounds) and performing strenuous physical labor under adverse field conditions.
* Individuals may occasionally be exposed to hazardous conditions, high places, and /or hazardous equipment. May work with or around chemicals that require knowledge of a safety data sheet.
* Prolonged periods of standing and painting.
* Must have adequate balance and ability to climb ladders and scaffolding.


**WORKING ENVIRONMENT AND CONDITIONS**


* This position requires working in varying environments including indoors and outdoors.
* Individuals may be exposed to varying temperatures including very hot (above 90 degrees F) or very cold (below 32 degrees F) and all\\-weather conditions.
* Individuals may be exposed to cramped workspaces, contaminants, extremely bright or inadequate lighting conditions, exposure to sounds and noise levels that are distracting or uncomfortable.
* This position requires a flexible work schedule; night and/or weekends may be required.


**TOOLS AND EQUIPMENT**


* Ladders, paintbrush, paint roller, drop cloth, masking tape, paint sprayer, caulking gun, putty knife, sandpaper, scaffolding.
* Tablet


**Note:** As in any Job Description, this description, including the list of essential functions is not exhaustive and may be supplemented, as conditions require. The Company reserves the right to modify the quality or quantity standards for this position based on changes in specifications, manufacturing, or other conditions.

title: Painting Subcontractor
description:
CertaPro is a leader in the residential and commercial painting industry. We are a national organization of professional painting contractors specializing in beautifying homes and buildings; interiors, exteriors, commercial, offices, and condominiums. Our success has been built on the foundation of delivering certainty to our customers – certainty of a job well done. We focus on the details of every project and most importantly, we focus on our client.


We are currently looking for a self\\-motivated and outgoing individual who is looking for a challenging opportunity to join our team as a Painting Sub. Our Painters are almost always busy, doing **outstanding work** and taking great care of our customers. They tell us they have fewer days off than our competition, so that means you’re **earning consistently** and growing right along with us. Our Painters work in both commercial and residential environments and follow a systematic approach that includes set\\-up, preparation, painting, clean up, and inspection.


The ideal candidate is a painting professional with the highest standards who has experience in both commercial and residential painting. He or she must be physically able to perform the duties of the job, which includes performing repetitive movements, standing for long periods, lifting heavy objects, climbing stairs and ladders, etc. If you are looking for a career with growth potential and are committed to personal and professional development, we may have a great opportunity for you!  

  

**RESPONSIBILITIES**

* Completes set\\-up duties at the job site, which includes moving all items in a room to the center and covering with sheeting and covering floors with drop cloths for interior jobs or power/hand\\-washing for exterior jobs
* Prepares surfaces for painting, which includes repairing holes and cracks, sealing stains, and sanding surfaces for interior jobs or removing loose paint, scuff sanding areas, and caulking gaps to prevent water intrusion for exterior jobs
* Paints surfaces by first priming repaired areas and then applying premium quality paint to a uniform finish
* Cleans up daily and after job is complete, which includes moving all items back to desired locations and sweeping/vacuuming floors and carpets for interior jobs, removing paint chips or other debris for exterior jobs, and removing all job materials
* Inspects work for the highest quality
* Understands and executes work orders in a timely and professional manner
* Maintains strict attention to detail when working at customer’s property
* Maintains clean, organized work areas and securely stores equipment and supplies
* Follows all safety policies and procedures
* Ensures that required documentation is complete and is in compliance with regulations and standards
* Maintains positive relationships with customers, subcontractors, suppliers, and other employees
* Promotes business development by projecting a positive image of CertaPro during interactions with employees, clients, subcontractors, and suppliers
* Participates in meetings, committees, educational opportunities, etc. as requested/required
* Performs other duties as assigned

**QUALIFICATIONS**

* Advanced education degree, coursework, or tech school a plus
* Three years of professional painting experience preferred
* Painting skills and knowledge of painting tools and equipment
* Industry knowledge preferred
* Strong communication and interpersonal skills
* Exceptional customer service skills
* Highly organized and self\\-motivated
* Quality conscious and detail\\-oriented
* Unrestricted driver's license and clean driving record
* Must have own vehicle

**BENEFITS**

* Formal On\\-the\\-Job Training Program
* Uniforms Provided

title: Sales Estimator
description:
Do you have a knack for connecting with customers and building quality relationships with them quickly? Does the idea of being in the field and visiting prospective job sites sound appealing? If you’re excited about helping people, providing solutions, and closing the sale, we want to speak with you immediately!

  

Five Star Painting is hiring a Sales Estimator in our area. As a valued team member, you’ll follow up on leads, provide accurate estimates to potential customers, and close the deal so our team can refresh their property with new paint.

  

We provide you with the leads – you just need to nurture them to close. We’ve seen time and again that the best estimators are those that take the time to build a relationship with the customer. When you follow our process at Five Star Painting, you’ll successfully close new opportunities while working outside the office and controlling your income.

  

This position is commission based, so being comfortable with knowing that you’re responsible for your own income is critical to finding success in this role.

 **Why You’ll Want to Join Our Team**


As a Sales Estimator, you’ll enjoy the freedom of working with our customers on location – no stuffy offices to sit in all day.


Because of our strong reputation in the community, you can trust that our customers will be happy to see you. This isn’t the cold\\-call selling you may be used to. We provide you with the leads, and you meet with the customers.


Our team is committed to your training and your success.

 **Responsibilities of a Sales Estimator**


As part of your sales activity, you’ll also be estimating jobs. You’ll be responsible for the following activities to succeed in this role:

* Meet with customers to listen and understand their needs.
* Accurately measure and estimate the cost of the job and confirm the services and materials that are needed.
* Clearly communicate expectations to customers.
* Accurately document and create written proposals.
* Schedule color consultations.
* Follow up with prospective clients.
* Support the marketing efforts by promoting Five Star Painting.
* Self\\-generate additional referrals from existing customers and new leads.
* Close new business to support revenue growth.

 **Requirements to be Successful**


From day one, we want you to find success as a Sales Estimator. That’s why we generate the leads and train you on how to estimate and close them.


Our most successful reps have the following traits. If this sounds like you, apply today!

* Ability to have a positive attitude that won’t let a “no” from a customer get you down.
* Organized, detail\\-oriented and strive to deliver extremely accurate estimates.
* Take pride in your effective communication skills when working with strangers.
* Maintain professional appearance and attitude when selling to customers.
* Team player who can also work independently if necessary.
* Reliable transportation to the office and our customers’ properties.
* Prior experience in home service sales is a plus.

 **Benefits**


The pay for this position is 100% commission after 90 days of training. You’re able to set your own income depending on your ability to accurately estimate and close customer deals.

  

Estimated Annual Compensation: $40,000\\-$100,000/year

  

Remember, we’re looking to hire only the best. If that’s you, APPLY TODAY!

title: Professional Painter
description:
**Love to paint?**

  

**Come work at the fastest\\-growing painting company in the PNW!**

  

**About us:** Arclight Painting is a veteran\\-owned company that's been serving the PNW area for the past 20 years. We stress the importance of quality craftsmanship, extraordinary service, and extreme ownership. Creating an environment where you want to come to work every day is what we are all about. So, if this sounds like you or if you're looking for something different in the painting industry, then look no further!

  

**Join our team!** (Watch this video to find out more: https://fb.watch/cLKwvAdMza/)  

  

**Benefits:**

  

* Performance bonuses
* Paid time off
* Rewards program
* Opportunities for advancement
* Tools Provided
* Safety equipment provided
* Once\\-a\\-month Happy Hour (and brews!)
* Year\\-round work

  

We are specifically looking to hire professional painters who have really strong core values, take pride in their work, and want to be a part of something . You should have painting experience, know how to use a sprayer, and aren't afraid of heights.

  

**Painter JOB DESCRIPTION:**


A Painter performs on\\-the\\-job activities pertaining to painting residential and commercial buildings in accordance with company policies, practices and governmental regulations. This includes preparation and painting of interior and exterior walls, ceilings and trim of residential and commercial buildings using brushes, rollers and sprayers.


Painter Responsibilities:

  

* Work in a professional, respectful, constructive manner, promoting a safe, positive, productive environment.
* Responsible for all residential and commercial paint work as assigned.
* Achieve painting quality as set forth by the PDCA Industry Standards (https://drive.google.com/file/d/1gndJvyEsuEWtEhwPAqE6Pk0DNBuy\\-VzO/view?usp\\=sharing).
* Apply quality finishes on cabinetry.
* Install new woodwork on construction or renovation projects.
* Take precautions to prevent spills, overspray drift.
* Protect furniture, plants, etc. with drop cloths as necessary.
* Supervise and train other apprentice painters who may be assigned either full or part time.
* Inspect completed work and evaluate quality and amount of work accomplished in given time.
* Estimate material and equipment required for assigned jobs and inform the Project Manager of the same when requested.
* Accomplish work in a neat workmanlike manner and leave the job site in a clean condition.
* Ensure that unsafe conditions inside and outside of job sites are corrected or brought to the attention of immediate supervisor.
* Ensure that current safety procedures as set forth in the Safety Handbook are followed, and that hazardous materials are handled, stored and disposed of in proper fashion.
* Work safely on ladders up to 32 feet in height, and climb all types of general use ladders.
* Attend employee meetings as requested by the immediate supervisor in order to keep informed of the latest developments and company issues.
* Ability to understand and adhere to standard operating procedures (SOP)
* Keep shop in clean, neat, orderly condition.
* Maintain reasonable care of company property.
* Maintain proper operation of the paint booth, with air filters changed appropriately.
* Maintain valid unrestricted WA State drivers license.
* Perform other duties as assigned


Qualifications:


* High school diploma or GED;
* Have at least three years of experience in interior and exterior residential/commercial painting on multiple surfaces, including drywall, masonry, concrete, wood, metal, etc.
* Two years experience in drywall taping, wall texturing, drywall repairs, etc.
* Be experienced in use of spray equipment.
* Have a valid, unrestricted Washington Driver's license.
* Have excellent stamina, as duties require one to move and maneuver material and equipment weighing up to 55 pounds or more.
* Must be able to lift, push, pull, and use abdominal and lower back muscles to provide support over time without fatigue.
* Ability to communicate in English orally and in writing in a professional manner

title: Commercial Estimator
description:
If you have commercial sales and estimating skills in the construction or painting industry and desire a stable position with great earnings potential, then join Amsberry’s Painting as a Commercial Estimator and Account Manager. You will manage incoming lead requests, prospect for commercial opportunities through bid board postings, and manage existing accounts to provide timely estimates and convert leads into sales.

We are a family owned and operated painting business that has one of the largest residential markets in the region, established over thirty plus years. In that time, we have worked hard to build a year\\-around operation that offers stability in the midst of traditionally very seasonal trade. We are looking for a skilled salesperson \\& estimator who values stability and is motivated by the opportunity to maximize income potential while providing exceptional client relations. In this position, you will enjoy the flexibility and problem\\-solving opportunities in a small business as well as the opportunity to grow your career technically and in leadership. We value training, developing, and promoting from within the company, offering you the opportunity to grow with us. Furthermore, we are highly interested in continuous improvement, so your creative ideas to improve the position are welcomed and encouraged.

For this position you must be experienced with commercial sales skills, client relationship management, and have excellent communication \\& time management skills.

Your next steps are to submit your resume in PDF form to the job posting and/or to . We look forward to hearing from you.

JOB DESCRIPTION:

Provide general contractor and property owner clients with personalized commercial estimates for painting services. Achieve sales targets and source new opportunities.

TRAINING:

Amsberry’s Painting will provide all the tools and training needed to perform this role. On the job training will represent a significant portion of this training.

* Service Fusion Training (Field Service Management Software)
* Estimate cost analysis tools
* Product and process training
* Sales skills training
* Estimate creation best practices
* Plan drawing takeoff training

RESPONSIBILITIES:

* Commercial Sales / Account Management
* Perform scheduled client site visits \\& managing daily activities
* Meet with clients at their commercial locations
* Estimate Creation
* Collection of data at client visits
* Utilization of tools for labor hours and pricing
* Daily check\\-ins with Sales Director
* Weekly meetings with sales team for planning and training
* Timely delivery of estimates to clients
* Timely follow up with clients
* Account Management
* Ongoing communication with general contractors
* Follow\\-up phone calls and emails to clients
* Prospecting
* Seek and source referrals and additional business opportunities
* Participate in trade shows and events
* Participate in sales meetings and training meetings
* Complete sales training checklist
* Maintain and Use Company Resources
* Maintain assigned company vehicle and estimator toolbox
* Use sample materials and client folders, replenish as needed
* **Dress professionally in accordance with company policy**
* **Other duties as assigned**
* Work with the Operations Coordinators to ensure client satisfaction and operational needs are being met
* Estimated hourly requirements are 45 to 50 hours per week

REQUIRED SKILLS:

* Experience in commercial sales and account management
* Excels at building a connection with clients
* Excellent problem solving skills
* Innovative thinker, energetic, detail oriented, resourceful
* Excels at independent time management

PREFERRED SKILLS:

* Painting experience
* Plan drawing analysis
* Plan drawing take\\-offs
* Fast typing and data entry skills

COMPENSATION:

* Base pay plus commissions and benefits
* Expected first year annual earnings between $100,000 and $140,000\\.
* Expected second year annual earnings between $120,000 and $160,000\\.
* Expected third year annual earnings between $140,000 and $180,000\\.

Pay: $100,000\\.00 \\- $140,000\\.00 per year

Benefits:

* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Compensation Package:

* Commission pay

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift

Work Location: In person

title: FOREMAN- Commercial Construction (Drywall, Drywall Finish)
description:
**POSITION OVERVIEW:**


The Foreman is responsible for coordinating operations and overseeing crew workers at our numerous construction sites. As the liaison between crew workers and superintendents the foreman will be the key person in charge of overseeing the completion of the project with a keen awareness of material expenses, permits, and employee safety.



The ideal Foreman will have a solid background in the field, strong leadership skills, the ability to direct the work of others and make quick decisions. The Foreman must always be well\\-organized and strongly focused on safety.



**PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES:**

*PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES INCLUDE BUT ARE NOT LIMITED TO THE FOLLOWING:*



Safety



A Foreman sets the standard by being an example, wearing their PPE, and promoting a safe work environment. Foremen are responsible and accountable for the safety of the crew under his/her direction. Looking out for the Safety of your team not only builds trust and keeps people safe but helps build a sense of teamwork.


*This includes:*


* Knowing, understanding, and following company and OSHA regulations.
* Facilitates mandatory safety toolbox meetings with the crew.
* Ensuring completion of initial safety and hazard assessments
	+ Maintaining, reviewing, and submitting a Daily Job Hazard Analysis (JHA)
	+ Weekly Site Safety Audits
* The ability to understand and fill out accident / incident paperwork.
	+ Injury Accident Reports
	+ Safety near Miss Reports
* Ensure equipment is inspected daily.


Leadership and Supervision



The Foreman coordinates the crew and must understand consistently apply the Company’s polices. The Foreman is required to be involved and supportive of any day to day disciplinary decisions.



*This includes:*


* Using daily huddles to communicate the job expectations to the crew
* Knowing his/her crew, their skill levels and using that knowledge to assign the appropriate people to each task.
* Recognizing, addressing, and resolving issues/problems among/between crew members
* Identifying, and repairing quality issues and coaching crew to minimize these issues.
* Ensuring crew compliance with project policies and procedures.
* Listening to his/her crew to meet the needs of the project and encourage communication.
* Assist the Superintendent and Project Manager in looking ahead for material and labor planning by using budgets and schedules to help keep jobsites efficient.
	+ Demonstrated ability to understand scope of projects, schedules, material and resource needs and effectively communicate with Superintendent and/or Project Manager when there are issues that might impact the project results (i.e., manpower shortage, missing equipment/materials, etc)

Planning and Scheduling



The Foreman is accountable for following project plans and schedules and ensuring that crews under his/her direction perform daily and weekly to meet production goals.



*This includes:*


* Translating general work requirements into prioritized work plan for the crew.
* Listening to the crew to overcome challenges and ensure they have what they need to meet the job expectations.
* Using install rates to keep from overmanning project and ensure equipment/material are ordered in a timely fashion.
* Periodically reassess daily goals/schedules/resources to meet forecasted production.


Employee Relations



The Foreman must champion an inclusive, respectful employee relations culture while being accountable for the adherence to policies and procedures by the crew.



*This includes:*


* Promoting, supporting, and facilitating teamwork and harmony between all crew members by promoting and fostering a positive, visible teamwork attitude among all crew members.
* Recognize and praise in a team environment when a crew member goes above and beyond.
* Seek crew members’ opinions and use their ideas. Give them credit and tell others whose idea it was.


Quality Control



The Foreman is accountable for ensuring that the completed work meets quality standards.


*This includes:*


* Onsite assessment prior to commencing work to ensure that job is ready, and addressing any concerns
* Overseeing the execution of the work, including quality and production, ensuring that the crew works to job specifications and follows the plan
* Clearly communicating expectations and measurements to crew and notifying project leadership when issues arise.
* Verify project quality with daily walk throughs. Provide coaching/corrective actions/recognition as needed.
* Inspecting and measuring completed work.


Administration



The Foreman is accountable for the preparation of reports as required by the employer.


*This includes:*


* Preparation of daily production records and daily logs.
* Reporting on work progress.
* Knowing, understanding, and enforcing company rules/policies.
* Worker violation reports
* Recommending personnel actions such as hiring, releasing, promotions and discipline


Professionalism



Regular and predictable attendance is required for this position. The Foreman’s work schedule is driven by the projects he/she is responsible for managing. Work hours/days are highly variable, unpredictable and require the Foreman to be flexible and available on a 24x7 basis.



**KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE** ***‘REQUIRED’*** **FOR THE JOB*****:***


* High school diploma or general education degree (GED) or certification in a skilled trade (Carpenter, Painter, etc).
* 5\\+ years prior experience/education with commercial steel stud framing/drywall/paint/finishing projects
* Demonstrated ability/aptitude to lead other crew members/projects. Have 1\\+ years managing field\\-based crews
* Have prior experience managing projects from $150,000\\+ and 6\\+ crew members.
* Extensive knowledge of construction best practices, equipment maintenance, and use, and OSHA guidelines.
* Current certifications in First Aid/CPR/AED, MEWP Certification, OSHA 30, Scaffold Competent Person, Fall Protection, and trade specific certifications.
* Able to work with a high degree of accuracy, with minimal supervision, in a high paced environment.
* Demonstrated knowledge and understanding of Company and project safety programs; occupational/safety, and environmental issues; employment standards and company polices.
* Must be proficient in personal computer/IPAD skills including email, Outlook calendar, recordkeeping, database activity, word processing.
* High degree of demonstrated professionalism and service to employees, clients and vendors required; must be able to deal sensitively with confidential information. Must demonstrate maturity and composure.
* Able to read and interpret procedural and instructional manuals to include job site / project specification sheets; write routine reports and correspondence; and speak effectively with employees of all levels and backgrounds, clients, and vendors.
* Able to read drawings, plans, and blueprints and convey this information to others.
* Understands and enforces the use of “best practices” for each trade when installing work
* Knows how to operate within policy guidelines and escalate a situation if necessary.
* Is ready to take on new challenges and is willing to learn
* Punctual and reliable attendance
* Adaptable and resilient; can adjust to change calmly
* Is a role model and leads by example
* Is seen as a team player by crews, peers, crews from other trades, PMs, leadership, and clients
* Is willing to motivate and mentor crew members
* Takes responsibility and is highly accountable
* Is honest and acts with integrity


**SKILLS AND COMPETENCIES THAT ARE ‘IMPORTANT FOR SUCCESS’ IN THIS POSITION:**


* Prior construction management experience with emphasis in effective communication and team building.
* Some level of Manager/Supervisor/Leader Training
* Can work independently and determine how to achieve objectives of assignment and follow through on details.
* Demonstrated competency and experience with equipment/materials inventory management.
* Bilingual English and Spanish


**SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIES:**


* Supervises diverse project crews up to 5\\-15 employees.


**PHYSICAL CONDITIONS:**


* Foreman is required to frequently talk and listen to others; drive to job sites; and walk through different types of terrain at a job site.
* Position requires full range of upper extremities in the manipulation of materials used in work processes, combined with simultaneous mental and muscular coordination.
* Must be able to lift and carry 50\\+ pounds on a regular/constant basis and up to 150 pounds when needed. (Materials include but are not limited to: loading and unloading of paint products, ladders, compressors, scaffolds, spray rigs.)
* Reaching above the shoulders and at shoulder height while carrying 30 pounds is required on a regular/constant basis.
* Must be able to push/pull 20\\+ pounds on a regular/constant basis; and able to push/pull 50\\+ pounds frequently.
* Must be able to frequently lift boxes, packages, equipment and miscellaneous items of up to 50 pounds.
* Ability to stoop/bend/stand and walk is required on regular/constant basis.
* Climbing scaffolds and ladders of various heights is also required on a regular basis.


**WORK ENVIRONMENT:**


* Construction/job sites can have less than ideal conditions, including poor lighting, little to no heat, little to no air\\-conditioning, high level of noise, etc.
* On a daily basis, the employee can be exposed to some air contamination (dust, paint fumes, smoke, disagreeable odors, airborne particles, etc.) and toxic or caustic chemicals in the work environment.
* The employee may work above ground level where the possibility of falling exists.


***In this position you will enjoy:***


* Stable employment in a sustainable, highly reputable, employee\\-centric company
* Competitive pay ranging from $30\\-$38 hr. based on experience
* Excellent Health \\& Wellness Benefits
* Training and Representation through the Western States Carpenters Union https://wscarpenters.org/(Drywall) and the International Union of Painters and Allied Trades (IUPAT) https://www.iupatdc81\\.org/home/ (Paint and Finish)

title: Painting Contractor (Residential)
description:
Five Star Painting is growing, and we pride ourselves in working with quality painting professionals! If you are a painting contractor interested in working with our team, please apply today!

title: Pro Sales Associate- Boulder
description:
To thrive as a Pro Sales Associate, you must be approachable, organized, and genuinely interested in helping our customers. Some basic computer skills are necessary to use our customer management software. An outgoing personality with a positive attitude will help you start up conversations with strangers and being a self\\-starter will be useful as well so you can jump in and help wherever you see a need. You don’t need to have any previous experience or knowledge in paint or sales. We’ll teach you everything you need to know, which makes this a perfect starting point to launch your career.

  

As our Pro Sales Associate at Behr, you’ll be working in a Home Depot store as a sales specialist focusing on professional painting contractors and their unique needs. On your own and working with the Pro Desk staff, you’ll meet and form relationships with local pros who rely on Behr for excellent products and exceptional customer service. You will build relationships with pros in the store who may be there for paint but are more likely there for something else. When an outside rep sends a contractor to you for paint, you will roll out the red carpet by collaborating with them to get exactly the right products for their needs, mix the paint, collect any sundry paint tools they need and get them in and out of the store quickly so they can get back to work. You will make our professional customers feel like they had a paint store experience.

  

Here’s what we’re looking for from you:

* An outgoing personality. You’ll support the Home Depot Pro Desk and introduce yourself to any contractors. Get to know them, their business, and their needs. You’ll maintain this relationship and follow up regarding their jobs and any future needs.
* Collaboration. You’ll work closely with Behr’s outside sales reps and take care of our customers when they come into the store, including pulling and tinting orders for pick up. You’ll also work closely with the Home Depot staff. We are all one team, so as their vendor you’ll be professional and helpful, working to maintain this mutually beneficial relationship.
* Basic computer skills. You’ll enter all your new leads and contacts into Salesforce, our customer relationship management tool. We can train you on this program, but all prior computer knowledge is a plus.
* Bilingual. You are not required to speak a second language, but many of our professional contractors do. If you have this knowledge, that’s definitely a bonus.
* A high school diploma or GED equivalent is required for all roles at Behr Paint Company.
  

Here’s what we offer you:

* Competitive pay and bonus opportunities. Sell more gallons \\= more money!
* Accrue 15 paid days off the first year.
* 401(k) retirement plan with 4% match.
* Competitive health plans for individuals and families.
* Check out behr.com/careers to view a comprehensive list of our benefits and perks.
  

Founded in 1947, Behr Paint Company is one of the largest manufacturers of paints, primers, decorative finishes, stains, surface preparation, and application products for do\\-it\\-yourselfers and professionals in the United States, Canada, Mexico, China, and Chile. The Santa Ana, Calif.\\-based company and maker of the BEHR®, KILZ®, WHIZZ®, and E\\&J® brands is dedicated to meeting the project needs of DIYers, professionals, architects, and designers with an unwavering commitment to quality, innovation, and value. At Behr Paint, we strive to have all team members bring their best selves and their unique perspectives every day.
