title: Commercial Paint and Wallcovering Apprentice
description:
For 75 years Heggem\\-Lundquist Paint Company has been a mainstay in the Denver commercial construction industry. We’re a family owned and operated business with a reputation for taking care of our employees and clients in the best and worst of times. We’ve seen it all and pride ourselves in having a “can do” attitude. If this sounds like you, we’d like to invite you to join our team of best in class commercial drywall professionals.


***POSITION OVERVIEW:***


The paint/wallcovering apprentice is an entry\\-level position focused on learning the skills and techniques required for commercial paint and wallcovering jobs. This includes the application of various coatings to surfaces such as wood, drywall, steel, stone and block at a variety of interior and exterior work sites, the application of following paints: oil base, latex and epoxies and the application of vinyl, fabric, paper wall coverings. The apprentice works under the supervision of experienced painting professionals to develop their expertise in this field.



**PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES:**

* + **Preparation of the Job and Work Surface –**Responsible for careful and safe set\\-up of the materials at the work site, which could include setting up ladders or erecting scaffolding safely to perform tasks above ground level. Employee is responsible for thorough preparatory work of the surface(s); and cleanly filling nail holes, cracks and joints with putty plaster or appropriate material. Will also smooth surfaces, using sandpaper, brushes or steel wool and remove old paint as necessary from the work surface. Removal could include paint remover, scraper, wire brush, to prepare surfaces for painting, and employee is comfortable in using those tools. May be required to remove old wallpaper and prep the surface for a clean application of the new material; and needs to be familiar with appropriate removal tools and products.
	+ **Painting –** Will use a variety of rollers, brushes and spray equipment on the job; and apply paints (oil base, latex and epoxy) to a variety of work surfaces including wood, drywall, steel, stone and block. Employee is responsible for knowing what level of preparation and paint application technique is the most appropriate for a given surface.
	+ **Paper Hanging –** Will use a variety of rollers and brushes on the job; and apply a variety of vinyl, fabric and paper wall coverings to the different work surfaces. Employee is responsible for knowing what preparation, adhesive and application technique is the most appropriate for a given material and work surface.
	+ **Special Wall treatments –** May be required to assist in the application of a variety of textured surfaces to walls and ceiling with trowels, brushes, or spray guns.
	+ **Clean\\-Up –** Employee also protects surfaces, trimmings, fixtures and windows, etc. as he/she works through and completes the job. Employee is responsible for clean\\-up of the work site and putting tools and equipment back in its proper place.
	+ **Safety\\-** Follow all safety protocols and guidelines to ensure a safe working environment for yourself and others on the job site.
	+ **Learning\\-** Learn and apply paint/wallcovering techniques, including understanding different types of methods and techniques, and the safe operation of tools and equipment.
	+ **Teamwork\\-** Collaborate with experienced drywall professionals and other construction team members to complete projectsefficiently and to the highest quality standards.

***In this position you will/ will have:***


* Ability to reliably work scheduled hours of 6am\\-3pm M\\-F.
* A high school diploma or equivalent (helpful, but not required.)
* Physical stamina and ability to perform physically demanding tasks.
* Willingness to learn and take direction from experienced professionals.
* Basic knowledge of hand and power tools used in the drywall trade is a plus.
* Strong attention to detail and a commitment to producing high\\-quality work.
* Basic understanding of safety protocols and the importance of following them.
* Must pass pre\\-employment drug test and E\\-Verify.
* Reliable transportation to and from work.
* Be able to read and understand construction documents in English.


***In return you will enjoy:***


* Stable employment in a sustainable, highly reputable, employee\\-centric company
* Competitive pay ranging from $18\\.94\\-24\\.35 hr. based on experience
* Excellent Health \\& Wellness Benefits (100% Employer Paid coverage for Individual and Family)
* Pension Plan Retirement Benefits
* Training and Representation through the International Union of Painters and Allied Trades (IUPAT) https://www.iupat.org/about\\-us/about\\-the\\-union

title: Union Shop: Painter, Drywall Finisher, or Wall Covering Specialist Wanted
description:
Are you interested in a fulfilling career in the construction finishing trades? We are currently seeking motivated individuals for immediate openings as Union Painters, Drywall Finishers, or Wallpaper and Wall Covering Specialists in the bustling Denver, Colorado Metro area. Experience is a bonus, and our partnerships with top employers offer training at zero cost to you. Join our apprentice training programs to access tiered pay increases and valuable benefits from day one, even as an apprentice. Starting wages are typically around $20 per hour or more, along with comprehensive employer\\-paid benefits like health insurance and a pension plan. As you progress to become a skilled Journey\\-person, hourly rates reach $25\\.00\\-$30\\.00 and beyond, with benefit packages adding an extra $10\\-$20 per hour. Your hard work and attention to detail will be well\\-compensated in this dynamic field. Don't miss this chance to thrive in a high\\-demand industry with opportunities for growth and financial security. In this important role, you will play a key part in transforming spaces with top\\-quality painting, drywall finishing, or wall covering work. Working with various tools in different environments, safety is a top priority. Reliability, dexterity, and a commitment to excellence are essential for delivering exceptional work.

**Responsibilities**

* Read blueprints/instructions and examine surfaces to determine the kind and amount of work necessary
* Make on\\-site preparations such as building scaffolding, covering fixtures, etc.
* Prepare walls and other surfaces for painting by scraping, using sandpaper, removing old paint, etc.
* Fill cracks and holes with appropriate material (e.g., plaster)
* Mix paint and other materials to prepare the right color or texture
* Paint surfaces according to instructions with various tools
* Apply varnish and other finishes
* Hang wallpaper and install wall coverings with precision
* Take and adhere to all health and safety precautions

**Skills**

* Proven experience as a painter, drywall finisher, or wallpaper specialist is a plus but not required
* Excellent knowledge of painting, drywall finishing, and wall covering materials and how to select, mix, and apply them
* Solid knowledge of commercial and/or construction painter, drywall finisher, and wall covering techniques
* Aptitude in using appropriate tools (brushes, caulking guns, etc.)
* Good basic math skills
* Manual dexterity with excellent balance to work on scaffolding, ladders, etc.
* Conscientious with great attention to detail

Job Type: Full\\-time

Pay: $20\\.00 \\- $48\\.00 per hour

Expected hours: 40 per week

Benefits:

* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Life insurance
* Professional development assistance
* Retirement plan
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift

People with a criminal record are encouraged to apply

Work Location: Multiple locations

title: PaintCare Program Coordinator for the Washington, DC, and Maryland
description:
**PaintCare Program Coordinator for the Washington, DC, and Maryland**


**Summary**


PaintCare seeks a qualified candidate to assist with administering the paint stewardship program in Washington, DC, and Maryland. This position requires a significant amount of in\\-field work to coordinate the activities of the PaintCare program.


**About PaintCare**  

PaintCare is committed to making it easy and convenient for households, businesses, and institutions to recycle postconsumer (leftover) paint in states with paint stewardship laws. A nonprofit organization created by paint manufacturers, PaintCare sets up drop\\-off locations for leftover paint, arranges for recycling and proper disposal, and conducts public education. PaintCare has managed more than 70 million gallons of paint, stain, and varnish in 10 states and the District of Columbia. For additional information, visit www.paintcare.org (http://www.paintcare.org/), like us on Facebook (https://www.facebook.com/WeRecyclePaint), and follow us on Instagram (https://www.instagram.com/werecyclepaint/) @WeRecyclePaint.


**Responsibilities**


* Responsible for overseeing PaintCare operations in Washington, DC, and Maryland. This will require regular in\\-person visits to paint retailers and reuse stores, local government household hazardous waste (HHW) programs, and other solid waste facilities, including transfer stations, landfills, and recycling centers.
* Provide excellent customer service by establishing relationships and regularly contacting participating paint retail stores, local government partners, and other program stakeholders to troubleshoot and ensure satisfaction with the PaintCare program.
* Identify potential paint drop\\-off sites for recruitment. Explain how to become a PaintCare drop\\-off site and evaluate suitability for partnering with PaintCare.


* Set up new paint drop\\-off sites by overseeing the onboarding process, which includes contracting, providing on\\-site training, and coordinating paint collection and transportation services.
* Arrange transportation services from temporary HHW events, plan and facilitate PaintCare\\-hosted collection and paint giveaway events, and process large volume pick\\-up requests from painting contractors, businesses, and other organizations.
* Hand deliver point\\-of\\-sale and outreach materials to potential and current drop\\-off sites. Monitor the use and usability of materials by sites; place sign and other point\\-of\\-sale material orders and follow up with sites to ensure delivery and use.
* Be a highly visible resource in the region for connecting the public with paint reuse and recycling opportunities. This may include participating in community events such as Earth Day.
* Make presentations to small and large groups (e.g., home shows, conferences, trade associations).
* Attend local, state, and national stakeholder meetings and conferences.
* Provide local knowledge and insight to our internal communications team to improve regional community engagement initiatives.
* Maintain a computer database of drop\\-off site information and generate reports as needed.
* Review and approve invoices for paint collection supplies, transportation, and processing services.
* Report to State Programs Manager.

**Preferred Skills and Qualifications**


* Experience with and/or knowledge of product stewardship programs, laws, and organizations.
* Experience with and/or knowledge of hazardous waste programs, services, and handling. Or local government HHW collection program and services.
* Familiarity with paint products and their applications.
* Familiarity and comfort with paint users, particularly trade painters, contractors, paint retailers, and property managers.
* Experience with and/or knowledge of retail operations and communications, including big box, chain, franchise, co\\-op, and independent stores.
* Experience with public speaking, training, and/or making presentations.
* Ability to self\\-motivate and work independently from home.
* Willingness to travel extensively within the District and Maryland to recruit sites, train retail staff and distribute outreach materials. Occasional travel to other locations in the U.S. for training, conferences, or meetings is required.
* Ability to receive and store bulk orders of point\\-of\\-sale materials, conference supplies, a booth kit, and other outreach materials for distribution to sites or use at conferences and events.
* Proficiency with computers and typical office software.
* Valid state driver's license required.

**Location and Travel**


The candidate must be located in Washington, DC or Maryland. While most of this position's responsibilities are completed remotely and in the field, the candidate may also use ACA headquarters, which is located in Washington, DC. Extensive travel throughout the District and Maryland will be required to visit drop\\-off sites and meet with local stakeholders. Overnight travel time will vary and may exceed 25% of the time.


**Employment, Salary, and Benefits**


This is a full\\-time, regular position. Salary depends on experience, but an estimate can range from $65,000 to $80,000\\. PaintCare, through the ACA, provides generous compensation, benefits \\[401(k), vacation days, medical, dental, and life insurance], and reimbursement for travel expenses.


**Diversity \\& Inclusion**


PaintCare is committed to fostering, cultivating, and preserving a culture of diversity, equity, and inclusion. We embrace and encourage our employees' differences in age, color, disability, ethnicity, family or marital status, gender identity or expression, race, religion, sexual orientation, veteran status, and other characteristics that make our employees unique.


**Apply**


To apply for this position, please visit https://american\\-coatings\\-association.breezy.hr/. Please submit a resume and cover letter stating your motivations for applying and your salary requirements. **Incomplete applications will not be reviewed.**

title: Sales Estimator
description:
Do you have a knack for connecting with customers and building quality relationships with them quickly? Does the idea of being in the field and visiting prospective job sites sound appealing? If you’re excited about helping people, providing solutions, and closing the sale, we want to speak with you immediately!

  

Five Star Painting is hiring a Sales Estimator in our area. As a valued team member, you’ll follow up on leads, provide accurate estimates to potential customers, and close the deal so our team can refresh their property with new paint.

  

We provide you with the leads – you just need to nurture them to close. We’ve seen time and again that the best estimators are those that take the time to build a relationship with the customer. When you follow our process at Five Star Painting, you’ll successfully close new opportunities while working outside the office and controlling your income.

  

This position is commission based, so being comfortable with knowing that you’re responsible for your own income is critical to finding success in this role.

 **Why You’ll Want to Join Our Team**


As a Sales Estimator, you’ll enjoy the freedom of working with our customers on location – no stuffy offices to sit in all day.


Because of our strong reputation in the community, you can trust that our customers will be happy to see you. This isn’t the cold\\-call selling you may be used to. We provide you with the leads, and you meet with the customers.


Our team is committed to your training and your success.

 **Responsibilities of a Sales Estimator**


As part of your sales activity, you’ll also be estimating jobs. You’ll be responsible for the following activities to succeed in this role:

* Meet with customers to listen and understand their needs.
* Accurately measure and estimate the cost of the job and confirm the services and materials that are needed.
* Clearly communicate expectations to customers.
* Accurately document and create written proposals.
* Schedule color consultations.
* Follow up with prospective clients.
* Support the marketing efforts by promoting Five Star Painting.
* Self\\-generate additional referrals from existing customers and new leads.
* Close new business to support revenue growth.

 **Requirements to be Successful**


From day one, we want you to find success as a Sales Estimator. That’s why we generate the leads and train you on how to estimate and close them.


Our most successful reps have the following traits. If this sounds like you, apply today!

* Ability to have a positive attitude that won’t let a “no” from a customer get you down.
* Organized, detail\\-oriented, and strive to deliver extremely accurate estimates.
* Take pride in your effective communication skills when working with strangers.
* Maintain a professional appearance and attitude when selling to customers.
* Team player who can also work independently if necessary.
* Reliable transportation to the office and our customers’ properties.
* Prior experience in home service sales is a plus.

 **Benefits**


The pay for this position is 100% commission after 2 weeks of training. You’re able to set your own income depending on your ability to accurately estimate and close customer deals.

  

\\[Pay is a % of completed job estimated]

  

Remember, we’re looking to hire only the best. If that’s you, APPLY TODAY!

  

Should you meet the requirements for the position, our system will schedule you for an interview immediately.

title: Painter
description:
**Dennis Moffitt Painting (DMP)** of **Wakefield, RI** is looking to hire a **full\\-time Painter**. Are you self\\-motivated, goal\\-oriented, and an energetic go\\-getter? **Do you want to work with a company that values and respects you?** Do you want to work in a trade where you can see how your efforts **positively impact** others? Do you take pride in the quality of your workmanship?


At Dennis Moffitt Painting we appreciate our team members and do our best to integrate them into something bigger than just a painting company. This Painter position earns a **competitive wage** of **$17\\-$24/hour**, depending on experience. We also offer **medical, dental, paid time off (PTO), 401k Retirement plan, consistent full\\-time work, safe worksites with up\\-to\\-date equipment, proven results, a friendly team, and a great work environment**. If this sounds like the right opportunity for you to take your painting experience to the next level of a successful, long\\-term career in a skilled trade, apply today!

 **ABOUT DENNIS MOFFITT PAINTING (DMP)**


We are a third\\-generation family\\-owned painting company that offers residential services across Rhode Island and commercial projects for Southern Rhode Island and beyond. We pride ourselves on our quality craftsmanship and customer service. Our clients arrive as customers and leave as family. We value living and working in a small community and try to do our part to contribute to its growth and well\\-being.


Our goal is to create an environment that makes our company the **best place our employees have ever worked**. We enjoy going above and beyond in everything we do. We continually strive to give back to the community through volunteer projects, throw Christmas and Summer parties to show our appreciation for our team, and individually improve the quality of life of each of our team members through dedicated training and mentoring. We've worked hard to develop a **unique, positive culture** that's based on the betterment of our customers, our employees, our community, and our trade. At the end of the day, the best reward in all this is seeing the smile and look of satisfaction on the faces of our customers that our skilled painting brings them. We **appreciate our team** and the effort that they put into their craft, and we **invest in them** through **top\\-quality training and equipment**. We also offer **competitive pay, great benefits,** and a **friendly work environment**.

 **A DAY IN THE LIFE OF A PAINTER**


As a Painter on our growing team, you are essential to our success. Your great results are partially due to the way you properly prep before painting. You take pride in painting efficiently with attention to detail and quality. With respect to property and belongings, you protect everything carefully and leave each workspace as clean or cleaner than you found it. You love that you are continuing to hone your craft and learn a marketable skilled trade!

 **QUALIFICATIONS FOR A PAINTER**

* 3 years of experience
* Valid driver's license
* Authorized to work in the US


Are you willing to work hard and go the extra mile for clients? Do you have a positive attitude and desire to learn? Are you ethical, honest, and reliable? If so, you might just be perfect for this Painter position!

 **WORK SCHEDULE**


This full\\-time painting job typically works **7:00 AM \\- 3:30 PM**.

 **READY TO JOIN OUR TEAM?**


We understand your time is valuable and that is why we have a very quick and easy application process. If you feel that you would be right for this painting job, please fill out our initial **3\\-minute, mobile\\-friendly application**. We look forward to meeting you!

title: Pro Sales Associate - Boston
description:
To thrive as a Pro Paint Specialist, you must be approachable, organized, and genuinely interested in helping our customers. Some basic computer skills are necessary to use our customer management software. An outgoing personality with a positive attitude will help you start up conversations with strangers and being a self\\-starter will be useful as well so you can jump in and help wherever you see a need. You don’t need to have any previous experience or knowledge in paint or sales. We’ll teach you everything you need to know, which makes this a perfect starting point to launch your career.


As our PPS or Pro Paint Specialist with Behr, you’ll be working in a Home Depot store as a sales specialist focusing on professional painting contractors and their unique needs. On your own and working with the Pro Desk staff, you’ll meet and form relationships with local pros who rely on Behr for excellent products and exceptional customer service. You will build relationships with pros in the store who may be there for paint but are more likely there for something else. When an outside rep sends a contractor to you for paint, you will roll out the red carpet by collaborating with them to get exactly the right products for their needs, mix the paint, collect any sundry paint tools they need and get them in and out of the store quickly so they can get back to work. You will make our professional customers feel like they had a paint store experience.


Here’s what we’re looking for from you:

* An outgoing personality. You’ll will support the Home Depot Pro Desk and introduce yourself to any contractors. Get to know them, their business, and their needs. You’ll maintain this relationship and follow up regarding their jobs and any future needs.
* Collaboration. You’ll work closely with Behr’s outside sales reps and take care of our customers when they come into the store, including pulling and tinting orders for pick up. You’ll also work closely with the Home Depot staff. We are all one team, so as their vendor you’ll be professional and helpful, working to maintain this mutually beneficial relationship.
* Basic computer skills. You’ll enter all your new leads and contacts into Salesforce, our customer relationship management tool. We can train you on this program, but all prior computer knowledge is a plus.
* Bilingual. You are not required to speak a second language, but many of our professional contractors do. If you have this knowledge, that’s definitely a bonus.


Here’s what we offer you:

* Competitive pay and bonus opportunities. Sell more gallons \\= more money!
* Accrue 15 paid days off the first year.
* 401(k) retirement plan with 4% match.
* Competitive health plans for individuals and families.
* Check out behr.com/careers to view a comprehensive list of our benefits and perks.

title: Pro Sales Associate - Boston
description:
To thrive as a Pro Paint Specialist, you must be approachable, organized, and genuinely interested in helping our customers. Some basic computer skills are necessary to use our customer management software. An outgoing personality with a positive attitude will help you start up conversations with strangers and being a self\\-starter will be useful as well so you can jump in and help wherever you see a need. You don’t need to have any previous experience or knowledge in paint or sales. We’ll teach you everything you need to know, which makes this a perfect starting point to launch your career.


As our PPS or Pro Paint Specialist with Behr, you’ll be working in a Home Depot store as a sales specialist focusing on professional painting contractors and their unique needs. On your own and working with the Pro Desk staff, you’ll meet and form relationships with local pros who rely on Behr for excellent products and exceptional customer service. You will build relationships with pros in the store who may be there for paint but are more likely there for something else. When an outside rep sends a contractor to you for paint, you will roll out the red carpet by collaborating with them to get exactly the right products for their needs, mix the paint, collect any sundry paint tools they need and get them in and out of the store quickly so they can get back to work. You will make our professional customers feel like they had a paint store experience.

**Here’s what we’re looking for from you:**

* An outgoing personality. You’ll will support the Home Depot Pro Desk and introduce yourself to any contractors. Get to know them, their business, and their needs. You’ll maintain this relationship and follow up regarding their jobs and any future needs.
* Collaboration. You’ll work closely with Behr’s outside sales reps and take care of our customers when they come into the store, including pulling and tinting orders for pick up. You’ll also work closely with the Home Depot staff. We are all one team, so as their vendor you’ll be professional and helpful, working to maintain this mutually beneficial relationship.
* Basic computer skills. You’ll enter all your new leads and contacts into Salesforce, our customer relationship management tool. We can train you on this program, but all prior computer knowledge is a plus.
* Bilingual. You are not required to speak a second language, but many of our professional contractors do. If you have this knowledge, that’s definitely a bonus.

**Here’s what we offer you:**

* Competitive pay and bonus opportunities. Sell more gallons \\= more money!
* Accrue 15 paid days off the first year.
* 401(k) retirement plan with 4% match.
* Competitive health plans for individuals and families.
* Check out behr.com/careers to view a comprehensive list of our benefits and perks.


Founded in 1947, Behr Paint Company is one of the largest manufacturers of paints, primers, decorative finishes, stains, surface preparation, and application products for do\\-it\\-yourselfers and professionals in the United States, Canada, Mexico, China, and Chile. The Santa Ana, Calif.\\-based company and maker of the BEHR®, KILZ®, WHIZZ®, and E\\&J® brands is dedicated to meeting the project needs of DIYers, professionals, architects, and designers with an unwavering commitment to quality, innovation, and value. At Behr Paint, we strive to have all team members bring their best selves and their unique perspectives every day.

**Company: Behr Paint Company**

Full time

The goal is for every single team member to have a voice and experience a sense of belonging here, regardless of where they sit in the organization and what their background is. We look forward to your sharing your outstanding and unique talents and perspectives with us!

title: Painter
description:
Painter \\& Drywall Crew
### **Description**


**Paint Bros MA is seeking a skilled Painter/Taper to join our growing team. The ideal candidate will have experience in both painting and drywall finishing, with a keen eye for detail and a commitment to delivering high\\-quality work.**  

* **Drywall Finishing:**
* Join drywall panels using tape and plaster, ensuring a smooth finish.
* Repair cracks and conceal imperfections on drywall surfaces.
* **Painting:**
* Prepare walls and surfaces by scraping, sanding, and filling cracks.
* Apply paint, varnish, and other finishes with various tools.

 **Requirements:**  

* High school diploma or GED.
* Minimum of 1 year of experience as a drywall finisher and painter.
* Valid driver’s license.
* Reliable Transportation 5 days a week
* Strong knowledge of tools, materials, and methods used in drywall and ceiling finishing.
* Ability to interpret construction blueprints.
* Familiarity with safety guidelines and regulations.
* Good basic math skills and problem\\-solving abilities.
* Excellent customer service skills.
* Physically fit and able to work a full 8 hour shift.

 **Benefits:**  

* Competitive pay with massive opportunity for growth
* Opportunities for professional growth
* Supportive and collaborative team environment
* Paid time off and holidays

  

At Paint Bros MA, we pride ourselves on delivering top\\-notch drywall and painting services to our clients across Massachusetts and New Hampshire. We are more than just a painting company; we are a lead generation and marketing powerhouse dedicated to building long\\-term relationships with our clients and community. Our commitment to quality, reliability, and community involvement sets us apart in the industry.  

Interested candidates should send their resume and a cover letter detailing their experience and qualifications to info@paintbrosma.com. We look forward to welcoming you to our team!
#### **Salary**


$18 \\- $24 per hour

description:
**Job Summary**  
We are seeking a skilled Painter to join our team. The ideal candidate will have experience in both interior and exterior painting projects, demonstrating a strong understanding of painting techniques and responsibilities. description:

We are seeking a skilled Painter to join our team. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in various painting techniques and materials, with the ability to work on both residential and commercial projects. title: Pro Sales Associate - Nashville
description:
**To thrive as a Pro Paint Specialist, you must be approachable, organized, and genuinely interested in helping our customers. Some basic computer skills are necessary to use our customer management software. An outgoing personality with a positive attitude will help you start up conversations with strangers and being a self\\-starter will be useful as well so you can jump in and help wherever you see a need. You don’t need to have any previous experience or knowledge in paint or sales. We’ll teach you everything you need to know, which makes this a perfect starting point to launch your career.**
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------


As our PPS or Pro Paint Specialist with Behr, you’ll be working in a Home Depot store as a sales specialist focusing on professional painting contractors and their unique needs. On your own and working with the Pro Desk staff, you’ll meet and form relationships with local pros who rely on Behr for excellent products and exceptional customer service. You will build relationships with pros in the store who may be there for paint but are more likely there for something else. When an outside rep sends a contractor to you for paint, you will roll out the red carpet by collaborating with them to get exactly the right products for their needs, mix the paint, collect any sundry paint tools they need and get them in and out of the store quickly so they can get back to work. You will make our professional customers feel like they had a paint store experience.

**Here’s what we’re looking for from you:**

* An outgoing personality. You’ll will support the Home Depot Pro Desk and introduce yourself to any contractors. Get to know them, their business, and their needs. You’ll maintain this relationship and follow up regarding their jobs and any future needs.
* Collaboration. You’ll work closely with Behr’s outside sales reps and take care of our customers when they come into the store, including pulling and tinting orders for pick up. You’ll also work closely with the Home Depot staff. We are all one team, so as their vendor you’ll be professional and helpful, working to maintain this mutually beneficial relationship.
* Basic computer skills. You’ll enter all your new leads and contacts into Salesforce, our customer relationship management tool. We can train you on this program, but all prior computer knowledge is a plus.
* Bilingual. You are not required to speak a second language, but many of our professional contractors do. If you have this knowledge, that’s definitely a bonus.

**Here’s what we offer you:**

* Competitive pay and bonus opportunities. Sell more gallons \\= more money!
* Accrue 15 paid days off the first year.
* 401(k) retirement plan with 4% match.
* Competitive health plans for individuals and families.
* Check out behr.com/careers to view a comprehensive list of our benefits and perks.

**Location**


1155 Bell Rd


Antioch, TN 37013


Founded in 1947, Behr Paint Company is one of the largest manufacturers of paints, primers, decorative finishes, stains, surface preparation, and application products for do\\-it\\-yourselfers and professionals in the United States, Canada, Mexico, China, and Chile. The Santa Ana, Calif.\\-based company and maker of the BEHR®, KILZ®, WHIZZ®, and E\\&J® brands is dedicated to meeting the project needs of DIYers, professionals, architects, and designers with an unwavering commitment to quality, innovation, and value. description:

Collaboration with clients, adherence to safety protocols, and attention to detail are key aspects of this role. If you have a proven track record in epoxy floor installation, an eye for detail, and a commitment to delivering high\\-quality results, we invite you to apply.

$20 \\- $25 hourly

* Demonstrate effective communication and teamwork skills.

**About Company**  

Paint It Right is a residential and commercial painting company with a supreme focus on customer service. Our company was founded in 2020, and since then we have had the fortunate pleasure of transforming over 1000\\+ homes in Ann Arbor and surrounding areas, plus many local businesses

  

Our values are simple. Treat every home like it's our own. Not only can you expect a beautiful result, but you can rest assured that our team members will treat you as if you are family. We promise to ensure you are pleased with our conduct and craftmanship.

title: Professional Painter
description:
POSITION SUMMARY

The first job of the Painter is to bring the job in on budget, with a happy customer who will recommend our company and you as a Painter. Participate in all activities related to the accomplishment of specific jobs. We expect you to treat our customers like royalty and respect your fellow employees at all times. We expect honesty, to own up to any mistakes made, and correct them as soon as possible.

ABOUT THE PICKY PAINTERS

Our mission is to help property owners who are tired of unreliable contractors improve their spaces with a quick, painless process. To deliver on our mission, we need Disaplined team members with Communications skills in all project phases. We are Results Oriented and hold each other Accountable for our mistakes. We are looking for people who are Aligned with our growth goals and will invest in their future. We always follow the Golden Rule with everyone we meet.

PERFORMANCE OBJECTIVES

* Perform all duties in the job description, follow safety rules and common sense safe\\-working practices.
* Document project progress daily with pictures of the work site and any issues.
* Learn, understand and apply The Picky Painter's procedures and processes to every project and let leadership know of any feedback to help projects run smoothly.
* Attention to detail by noticing issues on a project and notiying team members so they are fixed within 24 hours.

CAPABILITIES / KEY COMPETENCIES

* Work safely and use common sense safe\\-working practices.
* Must be able to communicate effectively with co\\-workers.
* Keeping a clean and neat appearance to represent the company in a professional manner
* Must be able to learn and teach the proper set\\-up, clean\\-up, and use of basic paint sprayers.
* Maintain cooperative working relationships \\& demonstrate sensitivity to, and respect for a diverse population

EXPERIENCE

* Must be proficient in surface prep \\& basic patching techniques.
* Must be able to mask, tape, and site protect areas before beginning work.
* Must be proficient in brushing, rolling, and basic spraying. Able to paint windows, doors, soffits, fascia, cabinets, and shutters without supervision in a competent, timely manner with the highest degree of craftsmanship and following The Picky Painters Standards.
* Must be able to remove wallpaper, backing, and glue without damaging walls excessively.

PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS

* Perform heavy physical labor \\& work in inclement weather, hot, cold
* Climb ladders and scaffolding (must not be afraid of heights)
* Move and utilize up to a 24' ladder alone for the entire work shift when required.
* Carry a full 5\\-gallon container of paint or equivalent weight up and downstairs
* Wear and use respirators when required for particulates
* Bend and reach while preparing and painting surface for the entire work shift

COMMITMENT TO DIVERSITY

The Picky Painters is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment based on race, color, religion, national origin, age, gender, sex, ancestry, citizenship status, mental or physical disability, genetic information, sexual orientation, veteran status, or military status.

A crew lead painter is responsible for running a job from start to finish and ensuring that all team members work to their strengths and are productive. Following our processes, maintaining equipment, and communicating with customers, subordinates, and the leadership team. We expect you to treat our customers like royalty and respect your fellow employees at all times. We expect honesty, to own up to any mistakes made, and correct them as soon as possible. Opportunities to upsell work, earn commissions and advance to higher positions in the company.

ABOUT THE PICKY PAINTERS

Our mission is to help property owners who are tired of unreliable contractors improve their spaces with a quick, painless process. To deliver on our mission, we need Disaplined team members with Communications skills in all project phases. We are Results Oriented and hold each other Accountable for our mistakes. We are looking for people who are Aligned with our growth goals and will invest in their future. We always follow the Golden Rule with everyone we meet.

PERFORMANCE OBJECTIVES

* Communicate with customers, company leadership, and crew about what is going on with the current project and where we need to be daily.

* Must understand job flow, execution, timelines, and project budgets.
* Learn, understand and apply The Picky Painter's procedures and processes to every project and let leadership know of any feedback to help projects run smoothly
* Attention to detail by noticing issues on a project and fixing them within 24 hours

CAPABILITIES / KEY COMPETENCIES

* Work safely and use common sense safe\\-working practices.
* Problem\\-solving when issues may arise with customers team members or leadership team
* Must be able to communicate effectively with co\\-workers.
* Keeping a clean and neat appearance to represent the company in a professional manner
* Must be able to teach the proper set\\-up, clean\\-up, and use of basic paint sprayers.
* Maintain cooperative working relationships \\& demonstrate sensitivity to, and respect for a diverse population.

EXPERIENCE

* Must be proficient in brushing, rolling, and basic spraying. Able to paint windows, doors, soffits, fascia, cabinets, and shutters without supervision in a competent, timely manner with the highest degree of craftsmanship and following The Picky Painters Standards.
* Must be able to remove wallpaper, backing, and glue without damaging walls excessively
* Must be proficient in advanced surface prep \\& patching techniques.
* Must be proficient in texture tools \\& techniques, matching and blending to the adjacent area.

PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS

title: Painter
description:
We are looking for a skilled Painter to paint the interior and exterior of structures, buildings and other surfaces. Your job will be important since good painting has both practical and aesthetic benefits. An excellent painter is knowledgeable in selecting the right material for their job. They have experience in painting with various tools and in various heights and spaces while observing all safety measures. They must be reliable and deft as well as possess great attention to detail in completing their duties. The goal is to deliver high\\-quality painting work.

**Responsibilities**

* Read blueprints/instructions and examine surfaces to determine the kind and amount of work necessary
* Make on\\-site preparations such as building scaffolding, covering fixtures etc.
* Prepare walls and other surfaces for painting by scraping, using sandpaper, removing old paint etc.
* Fill cracks and holes with appropriate material (e.g. plaster)
* Mix paint and other materials to prepare the right color or texture
* Paint surfaces according to instructions with various tools
* Apply varnish and other finishes
* Calculate costs and negotiate prices
* Take and adhere to all health and safety precautions

**Skills**

* Proven experience as a painter
* Excellent knowledge of painting material and how to select, mix and apply them
* Solid knowledge of commercial and/or construction painting techniques
* Aptitude in using appropriate tools (brushes, caulking guns etc.)
* Good basic math skills
* Manual dexterity with excellent balance to work on scaffolding, ladders etc.
* Conscientious with great attention to detail
* High school diploma; successful completion of an apprenticeship

title: Apprentice
description:
**SHOULD YOU APPLY?** 

Are you a pro at making people smile and thrive on connecting with homeowners? Do you dream big, crush goals, and believe life should be as colorful as your favorite paint palette? If so, welcome to the ultimate fun zone – our company!

Join a crew that turns dreams into reality and has a knack for turning rookies into rockstars in just six months!

No paintbrush experience required! We're Ohio's Top employer because we're all about serving up top\\-notch customer experiences with a side of flair! We're on the lookout for awesome individuals who vibe with our values and share the same hunger for success as our current squad.

We get it – life's too short not to have a blast while you work. Our flexible schedule means you can clock out and chill with your crew or kick back with your family as soon as the day's done. We're after folks who are friendly, hungry for growth (both personally and professionally), and ready to lead the charge to victory. Jump aboard today and join the Textbook painting team today!

**COMPANY AWARDS:** 

**We've been awarded some serious trophies for our epic growth and employee happiness:**

* Inc 5000
* Weatherhead 100
* Ohio's Top Employer by Crain's Business Magazine

**EMPLOYEE REVIEWS:** 

"The Textbook Painting bosses are legends when it comes to looking after their crew."  
\\-Sal (Lead Painter)

"I get to unleash my creativity on the job, and with bosses this awesome, it's a win\\-win. They're always up for a good time, and team\\-building events are off the charts!"  
\\- Liz (Job Leader)

"It's been an epic ride – rapid growth, quick promotions. It's like a motivational rollercoaster!"  
\\-Maddy (Painter)

"This crew knows how to hustle! Our CEO's a genius, always pushing us to be better. So much room to spread our wings!"  
\\-Ben (Painter)

**OUR SERVICES INCLUDE:**

At Textbook Painting, we're masters at making magic happen:

* Cabinet Painting (AKA Cabinet Refinishing)
* Exterior Painting
* Interior Painting
* Basic Carpentry
* Wallpaper Installation
* Customer Service
* Power Washing

**SAFETY:** 

Safety's our middle name! We take it seriously to ensure both our customers and crew stay safe and sound. From monthly safety shindigs to daily crew huddles, we've got your back. So, let's paint the town – safely!

***CREW RESPONSIBILITIES:*** 

* Adhering to the Injury and illness Prevention Program (IIPP) in their job areas
* Answering employees questions about the IIPP
* Have IIPP binder available on job\\-site for employees' reference
* Ensuring that all safety and health policies and procedures are clearly communicated and understood by all employees
* Providing weekly tailgate meetings
* Providing/overseeing daily Safety/Job Huddles
* Enforcing the rules fairly and uniformly
* Taking disciplinary action when necessary
* Doing frequent visual hazard inspections of work areas
* Bringing all safety issues including any hazards up in safety portion of weekly production meetings

**BENEFITS:**

* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

**HOURS PER WEEK:** 40 per week

title: Outside Sales Representative
description:
Do you have a knack for connecting with customers and building quality relationships with them quickly? Does the idea of being in the field and visiting prospective job sites sound appealing? If you’re excited about helping people, providing solutions, and closing the sale, we want to speak with you immediately!

  

Five Star Painting is hiring an Outside Sales Representative in our area. As a valued team member, you’ll follow up on leads, provide accurate estimates to potential customers, and close the deal so our team can refresh their property with new paint.

  

We provide you with the leads – you just need to nurture them to close. We’ve seen time and again that the best reps are those who take the time to build a relationship with the customer. We have also seen those who can develop new lead funnels accel quickly. When you follow our process at Five Star Painting, you’ll successfully close new opportunities while working outside the office and controlling your income.

  

This position is commission\\-based, so being comfortable with knowing that you’re responsible for your income is critical to finding success in this role.

 **Why You’ll Want to Join Our Team**


As an Outside Sales Representative, you’ll enjoy the freedom of working with our customers on location – no stuffy offices to sit in all day.

  

Because of our strong reputation in the community, you can trust that our customers will be happy to see you. This isn’t the cold\\-call selling you may be used to. We provide you with the leads, and you meet with the customers. Our team is committed to your training and your success.

 **Responsibilities of an Outside Sales Representative**


As part of your sales activity, you’ll also be estimating jobs. You’ll be responsible for the following activities to succeed in this role:

* Meet with customers to listen and understand their needs.
* Accurately measure and estimate the job's cost and confirm the needed services and materials.
* Communicate expectations to customers.
* Accurately document and create written proposals.
* Schedule color consultations.
* Follow up with prospective clients.
* Support the marketing efforts by promoting Five Star Painting.
* Self\\-generate additional referrals from existing customers and new leads.
* Prospecting for qualified leads (self\\-generated or referral appts are paid at a higher rate)
* Attend networking and chamber events to develop lead funnels
* Close new business to support revenue growth.

 **Requirements to be Successful**


From day one, we want you to find success as an Outside Sales Representative. That’s why we generate the leads and train you to estimate and close them. Our most successful reps have the following traits. If this sounds like you, apply today!

 **Duties:**

* Ability to have a positive attitude that won’t let a “no” from a customer get you down.
* Organized, detail\\-oriented, and strive to deliver extremely accurate estimates.
* Quality communication skills when working with strangers.
* Maintain a professional appearance and attitude when selling to customers.
* Team player who can also work independently if necessary.
* Reliable transportation to the office and our customers’ properties.
* Prior experience in home service sales is a plus.

 **Requirements:**

* Flexible schedule a plus
* Minimum of 2 years of sales experience
* Painting knowledge is helpful
* Safe driving history
* Pass criminal background
* Pass drug test

 **Benefits**

* Opportunity for advancement

 **Pay**

* $33,856\\.00 \\- $113,322\\.00 per year

 **Suplemental pay types**

* Commision
* Bonuses

 **Schedule:**

* 8 hour shift
* Monday to Friday
* Weekends and evening shift as needed

  

Remember, we’re looking to hire only the best. If that’s you, APPLY TODAY!

  

Should you meet the requirements for the position, our system will schedule you for an interview immediately.

title: Experienced Painter
description:
**Hernanz Painting Co.**
========================

**Experienced Painter**
-----------------------


Are you an experienced painter looking for a new opportunity? Join **Hernanz Painting Co.**, where we value skill, reliability, and a positive work ethic. We are seeking skilled and dependable **Experienced Painters** to join our dynamic team. You will be responsible for preparing surfaces, applying paint, and finishing surfaces to the highest standards.

**Hernanz Painting Co.** has been a trusted provider of high\\-quality painting services for over 30 years. We specialize in both exterior and interior painting projects, serving a wide range of residential and commercial clients. Our commitment to excellence and customer satisfaction has established us as a leading name in the industry.

**Responsibilities:**

* Prepare surfaces for painting by washing, scraping, sanding, and removing old paint.
* Fill holes, cracks, and joints with caulk, putty, plaster, or other fillers.
* Apply primers or sealers to prepare new surfaces for topcoats.
* Apply paint, varnish, stains, and other finishes to various surfaces, including walls, ceilings, doors, and trim.
* Utilize brushes, rollers, and spray equipment to apply finishes.
* Clean and maintain equipment and tools.
* Follow safety guidelines and regulations to ensure a safe working environment.
* Inspect completed work to ensure high\\-quality standards are met.
* Collaborate with team members to complete projects efficiently and on time.
* Communicate effectively with clients to understand their requirements and provide exceptional customer service.

**Skills and Qualifications:**

* Proven experience as a professional painter, with a strong portfolio of completed projects.
* Minimum of 2 \\- 3 years of painting experience.
* Proficiency in using painting tools and equipment.
* In\\-depth knowledge of painting techniques, materials, and tools.
* Excellent attention to detail and a meticulous approach to work.
* Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
* Good communication and interpersonal skills.
* Reliable and punctual with a strong work ethic.
* Physical stamina and the ability to work at heights and in various conditions.
* Valid driver's license and reliable transportation.

**Compensation and Benefits:**

* Full \\- Time
* Starting hourly wage at $22 to $28 per hour, based on experience.
* Profit sharing.
* 401k with company match.
* Paid vacation.
* Opportunities for career growth and advancement.

title: Construction Estimator
description:
Position: Construction Estimator

Company: Renewed Homes

Are you a detail\\-oriented, conscientious professional who thrives on consistency and accuracy? Do you prefer to work in a structured environment where you can apply your analytical skills to ensure precision and clarity in every project? If you enjoy concurrently working on multiple projects’ complex information and delivering reliable estimates, we’d love to have you join our team at Renewed Homes as a Construction Estimator.

Who You Are:

\\- Thorough and Analytical: You take pride in going through every detail meticulously. Nothing escapes your attention as you work through plans, specs, and site requirements to ensure accuracy in every estimate.

\\- Problem\\-Solver: When cost differences arise or challenges present themselves, you quickly collect and analyze all the necessary information before delivering a solution.

\\- Private and Focused: You prefer working independently or in smaller, trusted teams. Your approach is careful, guarded, and you open up only to those you trust. In your area of expertise, you are highly confident and critical in ensuring standards are met.

\\- Accountable and Dependable: Others rely on you because they know you will get the job done right. You’re driven by responsibility, and you make sure every project you work on meets the high standards you set for yourself.

\\- Detail\\-Oriented Communicator: You communicate directly and factually, particularly when presenting budgets, reports, or project plans. You take a reserved approach but are clear and precise in delivering the information that counts.

Why Join Renewed Homes?

\\- Structure and Stability: You’ll work in a well\\-organized, process\\-driven environment where your skills and thoroughness will be valued and appreciated.

\\- Consistency and Reliability: You’ll be part of a team that values predictable results and high standards. We trust you to deliver on every estimate with precision and care.

\\- Opportunities for Growth: We offer a role where you can continuously improve your skills, learn from experienced professionals, and work on a variety of exciting construction projects.

If you’re someone who is a multi\\-tasker, enjoys working through details, and excels at quickly delivering accurate and reliable estimates, we’d love to have you join our growing team at Renewed Homes.

Apply today by first clicking this link to answer the two\\-question survey, and provide all other information requested, to bring your expertise in construction estimating to a company that values accuracy, precision, and results. our success in delivering high\\-quality projects on time and within budget!

title: Bilingual Construction Project Manager
description:
Position: Construction Project Manager

Company: Renewed Homes

Are you a detail\\-oriented, process\\-driven professional who thrives on precision and problem\\-solving? Do you excel at managing complex construction projects from start to finish, ensuring they meet high standards and stay on schedule? If you’re a Bilingual Construction Project Manager with a passion for structure, processes, and results, we want you to join our team at Renewed Homes.

Who You Are:

\\- Methodical and Process\\-Oriented: You thrive in structured environments where you can create and follow systems to ensure smooth project execution. You leave no stone unturned, tracking every detail from start to finish.

\\- Precise Problem\\-Solver: You enjoy troubleshooting challenges with analytical thinking and thrive on resolving issues efficiently. You are most comfortable when managing multiple moving parts with precision and accuracy.

\\- Independent and Self\\-Sufficient: You take pride in owning your work, preferring to handle tasks yourself to ensure they are done right. Delegation comes only after trust is earned, and you follow up rigorously to ensure everything stays on track.

\\- Direct Communicator: Your communication style is clear, factual, and no\\-nonsense. You focus on getting the job done and expect the same from those around you. While not overly social, you engage meaningfully when necessary to achieve results.

\\- Persistent and Detail\\-Focused: Once you’ve committed to a task or project, you see it through to completion. Challenges are opportunities to refine your systems and processes, ensuring even better results next time.

\\- Motivated by Tangible Outcomes: You care more about results than recognition. Bonuses, financial incentives, and seeing a job well done are what drive you—not ceremonial awards or unnecessary praise.

Why Join Renewed Homes?

\\- Autonomy and Control: Manage projects your way, using your systems and processes to drive success.

\\- Results\\-Focused Environment: We prioritize outcomes over micromanagement, giving you the freedom to excel.

\\- Opportunities for Growth: We value continuous improvement and provide opportunities for personal and professional development.

\\- Competitive Compensation: We reward high performance with tangible bonuses and financial incentives.

If you’re a Construction Project Manager who thrives on precision, structure, and getting the job done right, we want you on our team. Your ability to create systems, solve problems, and manage complex construction projects will have a direct impact on the success of Renewed Homes.

Apply today via this link to complete the survey, answer the additional questions asked, and then bring your precision, and expertise to Renewed Homes!

Key Responsibilities:

\\- Project Planning and Execution:

o Develop detailed project schedules, scopes, and budgets.

o Ensure projects are executed on time, within budget, and to quality standards.

\\- Process and Systems Management:

o Create and maintain processes to streamline construction projects.

o Monitor and manage multiple projects simultaneously, ensuring every step is accounted for.

\\- Team Coordination:

o Collaborate with supervisors, contractors, and vendors to keep projects on schedule.

o Delegate tasks only to trusted team members and follow up on all assignments.

\\- Communication and Problem Solving:

o Maintain clear and consistent communication with clients, vendors, and contractors. Must speak English and Spanish.

o Troubleshoot issues quickly and efficiently to keep projects on track.

\\- Budget and Quality Control:

o Monitor project costs and ensure adherence to budgets.

o Conduct final inspections to ensure all work meets Renewed Homes’ standards.

\\- Documentation and Reporting:

o Track progress, update schedules, and document change orders as necessary.

o Maintain accurate records of project milestones, communications, and financials.

title: Door to Door Marketing Rep: Base Pay+Benefits+Bonuses+Growth Opportunity
description:
**NO EXPERIENCE is necessary for this position.**

**About the Company**

Who are we?

* *We are a small business that cares about growth. Not just the company, but everyone in it.*
* *We actually give a s\\*\\*\\* about our team, and want everyone in it to grow to become better at what they do and to become better leaders.*
* *We are easy to work with, and we believe that we're all adults here. Sure it's a job and you've gotta do your job, but we're not gonna babysit you.*
* *We want you to have a good life, not just a good job. So we give higher than average vacation time, and we'll even help you plan out your life so you can actually use that vacation time.*

**Compensation and Benefits**

What do we currently have to offer?

* $17\\.00/Hour (Plus Commission).
* If you're not good at it, you'll make **$17\\.00/Hour**
* If you're decent/good at it, you'll make closer to **$30\\.00/Hour**
* If you're great at it, you'll make **$50\\+/Hour**
* We've got a super simple process for the job that works, and we'll teach you how to do it, and will teach you quickly so you can go out and start making money.
* Obviously if you don't do your job, we're gonna have to talk to see what the problem is, but you'll be working with good people who are respectful.

What future opportunities do we have to offer?

* Potential for promotions and lateral changes within the company
* Ongoing training and coaching to help you evolve both at work and on a personal level
* Growth potential in the form of overseeing and managing other team members with increased pay
* Take home vehicle
* Health and Retirement benefits
* The opportunity to grow with the business

**What is our Mission?**

We are redefining the culture of contractor work to one of integrity, professionalism and opportunity for everyone who works with us. Right now the construction industry sucks, and everyone knows it. Contractors are unreliable, untrustworthy, and have little or no integrity. Opportunity in the trades is like trying to find Waldo in a sea of barbershop quartets and American flags. We’re changing that.

We operate with integrity. That means we won’t quit; on our customers, on you, or on each other. You’ll be able to have pride in your work because we take quality seriously too. If this position is a great fit for you, awesome! We want someone who fits well, but if it isn't a great fit, we aren't going to try to force it. After all, life is short and we want you to be happy too.

Sometimes you’re going to make mistakes here. That’s okay. Learn from them and we’ll grow together as a team! Your team will have your back, and you can have theirs without having to worry about constant CYA.

We learn through breakdowns. Sometimes customers may be unhappy. We will assess every situation from a point of curiosity and accountability to figure out what it will take to fix it and not make the same mistakes over and over again.

We are committed to your success. We have ongoing Marketing training, Marketing calls/meetings and Leadership calls that will help you grow as a Marketer as well as a leader in both your personal and professional life. Naturally as your leadership skills develop, increased opportunities within the company will also present themselves!

**What is the job?**

We’ll talk more about it down the line in the process if you’re selected, but here is a little about the position:

* In\\-field door to door marketing with homeowners looking to paint their home
* No pressure to sell, you are just collecting information
* Collecting home owner info for appointments to be set by our Office staff for our Sales team.
* 90% of your time is spent going door to door collecting potential customer information, meeting with potential customers, and positively representing the Company image in our community neighborhoods
* 10% of your time is spent on team building, meetings, trainings, and administrative tasks. \\*You aren't required to be in any meetings that don't provide value to you, and we actively try to avoid holding meetings that "could've been an email"\\*
* Heavily focused on personal and professional training \\& development
* No Experience Needed. We'll teach you how to do it (and it's super simple)!

**This might be a good fit for you if:**

* You Genuinely care about your community, customers, and team members, and love interacting with new people
* You are an optimist and have a positive attitude. Can maintain a smile after being told "No"
* You are competitive and love the thrill of outperforming others in your role
* You are very focused on personal training and development and investing in yourself
* You are very driven, motivated, and ambitious. A “Go\\-getter”
* You have an outstanding track record of results
* You are coachable and able to take constructive criticism in stride

This is a position with a flexible schedule. We can work with your schedule, and by doing so you'll have the ability to work full time, part time, weekends, evenings, or whatever schedule works best for you! While you aren't required to work a set schedule, you'll be coordinating your schedule and routes ahead of time, and some days/times will yield better results than others because of prospective customer availability. The Door to Door Marketing Rep is the person accountable for providing accurate potential customer information to help keep the schedule filled for the Sales team, and ultimately keep the schedule filled for our Painting teams. *Most* work will be done in Albuquerque but this position may require driving to and from the Albuquerque Metro Areas (Bernalillo, Rio Rancho, etc.) as well on occasion.

Qualifications and Requirements

Positive Attitude

Fun to be around

Door to door experience not required, but preferred

Proven track record of success

Strong communication skills

Strong work ethic, ambitious

Self\\-motivated and results oriented

Ability to work independently

Technical knowledge of the painting trade is not absolutely necessary, but would give you a "leg up" in answering potential customers' questions.

We have a few company vehicles and are actively working on getting more, but we currently do not have a company vehicle for this position, so you must have reliable transportation with current insurance. In order to be considered, you must have a clean and valid driver's license with no restrictions, and must have a working smartphone.

If you are currently working with a local painter or for another painting company in or around Albuquerque, we can be discreet about communication if necessary. However, we are advocates of respect and we do our best to maintain a positive working relationship with other painting companies in and around the area. We will require that you give proper notice to your current employer if this is the case.

If you've read this far and want a jumpstart on the other applicants, write us a cover letter to include with your resume. It doesn't need to be anything fancy, just include:

1\\. Why are you applying for this position? Why is it what you’re looking for?

2\\. Why would you be an excellent candidate and addition to our team?

3\\. Door to Door work can be great money, but is not for everyone. What traits do you possess that equip you for the position?

title: Sales Estimator / Project Manager
description:
Do you have a knack for connecting with customers and building quality relationships with them quickly? Does the idea of being in the field and visiting prospective job sites sound appealing? If you’re excited about helping people, providing solutions, and closing the sale, we want to speak with you immediately!

  

Five Star Painting of Lawrenceville is hiring a Sales Estimator / Project Manager in our area. As a valued team member, you’ll follow up on leads, provide accurate estimates to potential customers, and close the deal so our team can refresh their property with new paint. As a valued team member, you’ll schedule the project, communicate the progress of the project to customers, and finalize the project with a final walkthrough that meets customer needs.

  

We provide you with the leads – you just need to nurture them to close. We’ve seen time and again that the best estimators are those that take the time to build a relationship with the customer. When you follow our process at Five Star Painting of Lawrenceville, you’ll successfully close new opportunities while working outside the office and controlling your income.

  

We provide you with the project – you just need to nurture them to close. We’ve seen time and again that the best project managers are those that take the time to build a relationship with the customer and provide communication throughout the project.

 **Why You’ll Want to Join Our Team**


As a Sales Estimator / Project Manager, you’ll enjoy the freedom of working with our customers on location – no stuffy offices to sit in all day.


Because of our strong reputation in the community, you can trust that our customers will be happy to see you. This isn’t the cold\\-call selling you may be used to. We provide you with the leads, and you meet with the customers.


Our team is committed to your training and your success.

 **Responsibilities of a Sales Estimator / Project Manager**


As part of your sales activity, you’ll also be estimating jobs. You’ll be responsible for the following activities to succeed in this role:

* Meet with customers to listen and understand their needs.
* Accurately measure and estimate the cost of the job and confirm the services and materials that are needed.
* Clearly communicate expectations to customers.
* Accurately document and create written proposals.
* Schedule color consultations.
* Follow up with prospective clients.
* Support the marketing efforts by promoting Five Star Painting of Lawrenceville.
* Self\\-generate additional referrals from existing customers and new leads.
* Close new business to support revenue growth.
* Plan, schedule, and coordinate painting projects through completion.
* Solicit painting subcontractors and keep proper ratios of painting crews to estimators.
* Coordinating other trades such as: pressure washing, carpenters, stucco repair, etc.
* Lead meetings and ensure proper document control and recordkeeping.
* Ensure accuracy in estimates and job costing and facilitate weekly owner payroll reports.
* Guide project to completion to ensure proper close\\-out.

 **Requirements to be Successful**


From day one, we want you to find success as a Sales Estimator / Project Manager. That’s why we generate the leads and train you on how to estimate and close them.


Our most successful reps have the following traits. If this sounds like you, apply today!

* Ability to have a positive attitude that won’t let a “no” from a customer get you down.
* Organized, detail\\-oriented and strive to deliver extremely accurate estimates.
* Take pride in your effective communication skills when working with strangers.
* Maintain professional appearance and attitude when selling to customers.
* Team player who can also work independently if necessary.
* Reliable transportation to the office and our customers’ properties.
* Prior experience in home service sales is a plus.
* Ensure assigned projects are kept on schedule and within budget while meeting clients’ needs and delivering a quality project.
* Plan, schedule, and coordinate painting projects through completion.
* Solicit painting subcontractors and keep proper ratios of painting crews to estimators.
* Coordinating other trades such as: pressure washing, carpenters, stucco repair, etc.
* Lead meetings and ensure proper document control and recordkeeping.
* Ensure accuracy in estimates and job costing and facilitate weekly owner payroll reports.
* Guide project to completion to ensure proper close\\-out.

 **Benefits**


The pay for this position offers a base salary along with commission after 90 days of training. You’re able to set your own income depending on your ability to accurately estimate and close customer deals.

  

Remember, we’re looking to hire only the best. If that’s you, APPLY TODAY!

  

Should you meet the requirements for the position, our system will schedule you for an interview immediately.

title: Residential painters
description:
John White Painting, Inc. (JWP) is one of Omaha’s premier residential painting companies, specializing in upper\\-end residential new construction, remodels, and custom cabinetry finishes. In 1948, Dave’s son, John, has continued the White family painting legacy under John White Painting, Inc., and is committed to producing the finest painting finished products and providing the best client experience.



With a professional, but collegial shop culture—a place where conversation seamlessly flows from work to weekend plans and back again, a place where everyone in the company cares about your growth in the industry—JWP is fully invested in its employees, offering advancement opportunities, new facilities, lettered trucks, work apparel, excellent benefits, and highly competitive, experience\\-based pay.



At JWP, we believe we are craftsmen, not laborers. We believe in the physically\\-demanding, intellectually\\-rigorous, personally\\-humbling and yet absolutely spiritually\\-fulfilling reward of learning, honing, and mastering this craft. We believe in and endorse the search for innovation in methodology, products, and tools. We believe in empowering colleagues with the confidence, skills, and tools to accomplish each project.



At JWP we are not about ego. We do not claim to know everything in the painting industry. We believe in the journey of mastering this craft, and understand, appreciate, and respect differences in where each colleague is in their own journey.


#### **Job Description**


Prepare work site and paintable surfaces for finish; apply products and perform work tasks listed on job specifications; interact with contractors, supervisors, designers, and clients in a professional manner; clean work area and tools.


#### **Job Responsibilities**


* Follow all OSHA standards and procedures to ensure safety
* Provide excellent client service by acting courteously and promptly to client/contractor needs and specifications
* Prepare work sites and paintable surfaces for finish work (protect floor with drops, cover furniture with painter’s plastic, cover other potentially affected areas, tape base, putty and sand nail holes, mud and sand holes in walls, etc.) to the highest industry standard
#### **Position Requirements**


* Valid driver’s license required
* High school diploma or GED preferred
* Previous painting experience preferred, but we will gladly train
* Must be able to read and effectively interpret job specification and safety documents
* Must be able to stand, walk, kneel, bend, lift, grasp, twist, and stretch
* Must be able to lift, push, or pull 50 lbs; may occasionally need to lift more
* Must be able to learn, understand, and safely use hand and power tools
* Communicate effectively with job superintendents, supervisors, and clients
* Ability to work independently is preferred
* Ability to analyze problems and enact appropriate, timely, and effective solutions
* Ability to work as a member of a team to accomplish larger jobs and projects
* Interact with clients and colleagues in a professional, well\\-groomed, and positive manner
* Ensure appropriate standards of professional conduct and hygiene on\\-site
#### **Job Benefits**

* Competitive, experience\\-based pay


* Paid vacations and holidays


* Subsidized uniform program


* Rewarding career in an exciting field

title: Pintor Pintora Painter Residential Residencial
description:
En WOW 1 DAY PAINTING, nuestra misión es entregar un trabajo pintura de calidad en un tiempo inesperado. ¿Como hacemos eso? Todo comienza con nuestros friendly pintores, uniformados, que se conectan con nuestros clientes y les brindan un servicio excepcional a tiempo. Estamos muy bien organizados, hacemos excelente trabajo, creemos en el trabajo en equipo y comenzamos y terminamos a tiempo. **Quality \\+ Speed \\= WOW**


  

**Pintor (Spanish Speaker)**  

Tiempo completo / Full\\-time  

Rango de pago entre $16\\-$22/hr (basado en su experiencia, habilidades \\& responsabilidades)  

  

\\*\\* Estaremos contentos de pagarle segun su experiencia y nos encantaria que gane cada vez mas en el tiempo.  

\\*\\* Se procesan los pagos todos los viernes, sin excepcion y sin excusas por medio deposito directo (se descuentan los taxes).  

\\*\\* Se ofrece seguro de Workers Compensation a todos los trabajadores de la empresa.  

\\*\\* Excelente ambiente de trabajo! Para nosotros es importante contar con buenos pintores, pero igual de importante es contar con un buen ambiente de trabajo agradable.  

\\*\\* El horario de trabajo la mayoria de las veces es de Lunes a Viernes de 8am \\- 4\\.30pm. Hay veces se entra a las 9am y se sale a las 4pm, 4\\.30pm o 5\\.30pm. Independientemente que se trabajen menoss horas, nosotros pagamos el dia full de trabajo.  

\\*\\* No pagamos por hora, valoramos el rendimiento de un dia de trabajo.  

\\*\\* Debes saber cortar y rolear bien, haciendo trabajo de calidad y con buenos tiempos.  

\\*\\* No hacemos bamba. Mas bien, la matoria de nuestros trabajos son trabajos de interior, repintes de casas high\\-end, amoblados y con aire acondicionado!  

  

  

**Responsabilidades :**
* Trabajar en equipo para cumplir con los requerimientos de pintura de cada proyecto.
* Llegar a tiempo a todos los trabajos y no faltar a su jornada laboral.
* Hacer trabajo de pintura de calidad, rapido y estar pendiente de los detalles en cada area en la que se trabaja.
* Cubrir las areas de trabajo con plastico, papel o drop cloth.
* Seguir las indicaciones del Jobsite Manager o Encargado
* Ayudar con la limpieza de todos los trabajos
* Mantener un excelente servicio al cliente.
* Mantener el uniforme de trabajo en condiciones presentables y siempre estar uniformado con buena presencia.


  

**Requerimientos para el cargo:**
* Experiencia minima de 2\\-3 anos.
* Debe tener su permiso de trabajo vigente y estar legal en el pais.
* Experiencia en trabajos de pintura de Interior y exterior.
* Debe tener su propio vehiculo y tener sus herramientas basicas para el trabajo.

La gente que empieza con nosotros, se quda con nosotros, y estamos orgullosos de poder decir esto!
