title: Estimator
description:
**Company Description**

Five Star Painting of Chesapeake provides a first\\-class customer interior and exterior painting experience for clients. From offering free consultations, providing an easy to follow scheduling process and a quality assurance check at the end of each job, we commit to providing a seamless customer experience from start to finish. This locally\\-owned company treats each project with a commitment to deliver what was promised, maintains a clean project space, and performs work on time and on budget.

**Role Description**

This is a full\\-time on\\-site role for a Manager of General Sales and Production at Five Star Painting of Chesapeake located in Chesapeake, VA. The Manager of General Sales and Production will be responsible for managing and overseeing sales, production, and customer service. The General Sales/Production Manager will coordinate and guide residential/commercial painting jobs through the scheduling and execution stages and serve as the focal point for communication among various parties. This person will ensure the customers’ needs are clearly understood and documented via a written proposal and change orders. The General Sales Manager will develop a close working relationship with the Owner, consultants and the painting crews to ensure all expectations set forth on the written proposal are met. He or she will be a critical team member, building long\\-term customer relationships and generating leads through community partnerships and new customer connections. Our values are focused on delivering the best painting service in the industry.

**Qualifications**

* Detail\\-oriented
* Positive attitude
* Professional appearance and personality
* Team player who can work independently
* Customer\\-focused leader
* Excellent follow up skills
* 3\\+ years sales experience
* Ability to solve problems quickly and professionally
* Construction or painting experience under a licensed contractor preferred, but not required

**Daily Responsibilities:**

* As a General Sales and Production Manager, you are the primary point of contact in the service territory, upholding our commitment to customer satisfaction and professionalism.
* You are responsible for consulting with clients, preparing accurate estimates while growing new relationships and cultivating existing relationships.
* Exemplifying our code of values, you show respect and courtesy to all clients and fellow team members.
* Meet with clients and learn about their project(s) to generate accurate and detailed quote(s) for the work.
* Follow up with prospective clients by phone, text, and/or email.
* Track jobs via standard reports and maintain high quality standards via a customer checklist during job close\\-out.
* Ensure that our clients’ needs and their expectations are clearly communicated and accurately documented on a written proposal.
* Build a local network and prospect for potential clients.
* Work with subcontractor foreman to schedule work and ensure professional, quality job completion.

**This is a commission\\-based opportunity.** Salary includes base ($30K) plus commission estimate for first year sales. Opportunity for additional salary growth. Benefits are available.

title: Commercial and Residential Painter - 2 yrs exp req
description:
Nickelson Painting, your go\\-to choice for high\\-quality painting and related services since 1990, is currently **searching for talent** in Rochester and surrounding areas! When you join Nickelson Painting, you’re joining a team known for industry excellence, customer loyalty, and professional, **skilled painters**.

Here at Nickelson Painting we offer a career, not just a job. We have several training programs that will help you achieve your personal career goals and move up within the company!

We are looking for professional painters! Experience is required for this position so please only apply of you possess the skills below:

* **Residential painting: 2 year (Required)**
* **Commercial painting: 1 year (Required)**
* Prepare surfaces such as, wash, scrape, sand, fill cracks and holes.
* Apply paint using, rollers, brushes, sprayers
* Paint matching
* Perform other related work such as, caulking, finish repair, mud, tape, hang wallpaper
* Being able to receive and follow instructions
* Reading and adhering to labels, safety warnings, and guidelines
* Being alert to ensure safety
* Having previous painting experience
* Being proficient with painting tools and equipment
* Being able to safely operate various vehicles and equipment

Give us a call regarding any questions our painter job or our benefits package that is among the top of the industry.

Pay is based on painting experience and skill and our starting wage ranges from $18\\-$25 per hour. Additional trade skills are a plus (drywall, carpentry, etc.) We hope to speak with you soon!

title: Production Manager + Leadership Opportunity + Power Over Your Schedule
description:
**Production Manager \\+ Leadership Oppurtunity \\+ Power over your schedule**

I’m Dan Zeuli \\- the CEO of Zeuli Paint \\- you will be working directly with me.

**You should keep reading this if…**

* You love relationships and people…
* You want to work your way into a leadership role where you can have a big impact…
* You want to be a part of an increasingly exciting and growing company…
* You just can’t stand sitting behind a desk all day…
* You crave self\\-development and personal growth…
* You enjoy diving head\\-first into problems and bringing order where it is needed…
* You want to **raise the average** at Zeuli Paint…More to come on this later!

**What it’s like to work with me…**

* **Autonomy** \\- I’m not a micro\\-manager. We’re all adults. We all have a job to do, and we trust each other to do our jobs.
* **Balance** \\- We believe that working with Zeuli Paint should add to your life…not take away from it. Our team performs at a very high level, but not at the expense of working long hours, nights, or weekends.
* **Growth** \\- As we grow each year, you will be presented with more and better opportunities. It will be exciting and rewarding, and everyone will benefit from it. You are who we need for what comes next!
* **Self\\-Development \\-** While many companies say they invest in their employees… we take this to a new level, giving us the upper hand in our area. We constantly take the time to improve our people and our systems. Much of the material we cover can also be applied to improve other areas of your life. I guarantee you have never heard of some topics/angles we work on.
* **Performance\\-oriented** \\- I don’t care how long you work or how “busy” you look. You get paid for the excellent work that you do at Zeuli Paint, and we believe that you can do that while having a flexible schedule, time off and the ability to do things that are most important in life.

**With me so far?** 

I'll do my best to introduce our company and this opportunity. But remember, we'll spend much more time in our interview process getting to know each other.

We have a lot of exciting things happening here \\- more than I can fit into a job post.

**About Zeuli Paint**

**Who We Are:**

We are not just “any old painting company.” Zeuli Paint is redefining what clients can expect from a Painting Company and creating a work environment where our team can truly thrive.

**What We Believe:**

The home improvement industry and the trades are broken.

Homeowners all have horror stories about working with their contractors.

Contractors are overworked and run their businesses by the seat of their pants—these are not professionally built organizations.

Employees who work for painting companies are overworked, underpaid, and stressed out.

We could go on and on…

***We believe the best and most successful business is the business where everyone wins...*** 

Where employees LOVE their work, are well compensated, enjoy a work\\-life balance, and have opportunities to grow in their careers.

Where customers have an exceptional experience from beginning to end \\- an experience so great they would brag about it at a dinner party.

And when everyone a business touches is winning... The business experiences enormous success.

And so does the business owner.

And so does everyone in Zeuli Paint.

This is the kind of business we are creating.

**What We Do:**

Providing a quality paint job is our baseline—the starting point.

At Zeuli Paint, we focus on creating lasting, meaningful relationships with our clients, ensuring they feel taken care of every step of the way.

We’ve achieved record numbers for three consecutive years, and we’ve done it sustainably without sacrificing our team’s well\\-being or clients’ trust.

**Responsibilities**

Fundamentally, the job is…

● Helping customers prepare for their paint job. This includes constant communication, scheduling the start date, and understanding their needs and what is important to them.

● Maintaining clear and thorough communication with our customers throughout the entire process of the job and creating a lasting relationship with our clients.

● Managing the production schedule to ensure jobs are delivered on time by coordinating with our painters, subcontractors, and customers.

● Hiring, training, and managing painting crews, primarily working with subcontractors for now.

● Resolving any and all customer complaints or issues that arise \\- going above and beyond to ensure an excellent customer experience.

● Providing an amazing experience for our clients.

● Ensuring jobs are being done correctly, timely, with clean job sites

● Managing and maintaining profit margins and efficiency on each job.

**What’s Required \\- About YOU**

● A preference towards customer service and delivering an amazing experience to people–you pride yourself on your ability to serve people.

● You love relationships and people \\- both your clients and the people you work with.

● Leadership \\- you value your relationships but also know when to be a boss and leader.

● You're a great problem solver \\- you thrive when presented with a problem and love to find solutions.

● You have strong communication skills and empathy

● Strong organizational and time management skills \\- you thrive when things are "in order" but can always bring order to a situation that doesn't have it.

● Proficient with Google Drive (sheets, docs, file management) \\- and technology in general.

● Comfortable working "in the field" and spending time in your car, on job sites, and meeting with clients and employees (most jobs are in or around Hudson, WI). This is a fast\\-paced and interactive role.

● Experience in areas related to this role

***And, if you excel, there will be future growth opportunities to lead this department... And we will provide the leadership training to help you get there.***

**How to Apply**

1\\. Submit your resume. Only people with the required experience will be considered.

2\\. Submit a cover letter. In your cover letter, please include... Why are you interested in this job? And why are you a perfect fit for this role?

Please address Zeuli Paint in your cover letter, so I know you read this!

A resume and cover letter are required to be considered for this position.

**What to Expect After You Apply**

This is a critical role for our company and organization. We will be highly selective. Due to the high number of responses we expect to get to this position, I'll only be contacting people who are "moving on to the next step".

The next step is a phone conversation with me.

I'll be reviewing applications 3\\-5 times per week.

You can expect a phone call from me within 48 hours (not including weekends) if I plan on moving to that next step with you.

If you haven't heard from me within 48 hours, it means I didn't think this position was the right fit for you and good luck in your job search!

Job Type: Full\\-time

Pay: $50,000\\.00 \\- $90,000\\.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching
* Flexible schedule
* Health insurance

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday
* Weekends as needed

Ability to Commute:

* Hudson, WI (Required)

Work Location: On the road

title: General Manager (GM)
description:
**Job Description: General Manager Commercial Division**

We are looking to hire a GM for our Commercial Division. Our ideal candidate has a proven track record of growth and leadership with specific expertise in the commercial painting industry.

**About M. Carlson Painting:**

M. Carlson Painting is a growing residential and commercial painting company with high\\-end customers. We're professional painters, dedicated to high quality and service.

Our reputation is based upon making sure that the details of every project, interior or exterior, are carried forward from start to finish. Our team is composed of professional painters and leaders in the industry. We are committed to getting the job done right, on time, and within budget. Our commitment to customer satisfaction has led to our industry\\-leading repeat and referral performance.

Come work with us and find out why we have been voted the Best Painting Contractor in MN for three years in a row; 2021, 2022 and 2023\\.

**The Team Member We Are looking for…**

* Is fun, polite, courteous, growth\\-minded, and professional
* Is resourceful and has an awesome can\\-do attitude, and takes initiative
* Is excellent at managing tasks, organized and detail\\-oriented
* Enjoys working hard and strives for greatness all while having a blast
* Has a positive attitude and a welcoming presence that helps motivate the team
* Thrives working with a team and looks for opportunities to help drive the business forward
* Has excellent communication and listening skills that set others up for success (Spanish is a plus)
* Background in painting/trades/hospitality is preferred
* Valid driver's license, auto insurance and reliable transportation

**Your Responsibilities \\& Skills…**

* Creating an amazing experience for our customers
* Grow and lead the division. Focus on owner direct repaint work, Multi\\-Family, Hospitality, Property Management, Procurement Projects and some new construction.
* Manage the Commercial Division team of sales and project managers.
* Report to the CEO and be a part of the goal setting for the Commercial Division.
* Work with the admin and finance teams to develop better efficiencies for systems and processes.
* Problem\\-solving, which frees everyone up to excel in their roles
* Network to generate new leads
* Contact leads, schedule appointments, meet with prospective customers onsite to accurately estimate cost of jobs and services
* Follow up with prospective customers in order to finalize deals
* Ability to hit monthly KPI’s (Key Performance Indicators) with a goal of closing 50% of leads given to you
* Coordinate with customers and crews from the initial lead to the completion of the project and beyond
* Compile and confirm the scope and timeline of the project. Use checklists and change orders to effectively manage the job
* Ensure that projects run smoothly, everyone is on the same page from start to finish and any issues are addressed taken care of in a timely manner
* Ensure that our customer’s needs and expectations are clearly communicated and accurately documented on all estimates
* Follow through with customers to ensure their complete satisfaction with the project and request payment, google reviews, referrals and future projects ideas

**Position Qualifications…**

* 10\\+ years as a commercial paint estimator or project manager
* Specific experience in commercial painting is required
* Understanding of the paint products, process and able to effectively communicate with crews and customers
* Must have the ability to utilize technology

**Your Benefits include…**

* Commission\\-based compensation
* 401k, ICHRA, Colonial
* Logo shirts, hats, sweatshirts and jackets provided
* Tablet/laptop, phone and professional marketing support materials
* Paid time off and holidays
* Training provided
* Fun, upbeat atmosphere with an office space when needed
* Full\\-time hours
* A purpose\\-filled career that makes a difference in your community
* Great opportunity to be an integral part of an amazing and diverse team

We look forward to hearing from you!

**M. Carlson Painting**

3496 Shoreline Drive

Wayzata, MN 55391

Mcarlsonpainting.com

952\\-933\\-9968

shanna@mcarlsonpainting.com

Job Type: Full\\-time

Pay: From $65,000\\.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k) matching
* Paid time off

Shift:

* Day shift

License/Certification:

* Driver's License (Preferred)

Ability to Commute:

* Wayzata, MN 55391 (Required)

Ability to Relocate:

* Wayzata, MN 55391: Relocate before starting work (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: Administrative Coordinator
description:
**Job Description: Administrative Coordinator**

Our Administrative Coordinator role requires an energetic professional with excellent organization and communication skills to keep up with ever\\-changing tasks. This person needs to be a strong and reliable support to our internal teams as well as our customers. Multitasking while focusing on efficiency and time management are the keys to this role.

**About M. Carlson Painting:**

M. Carlson Painting is a growing residential and commercial painting company with high\\-end customers. We're professional painters, dedicated to high quality and service.

Our reputation is based upon making sure that the details of every project, interior or exterior, are carried forward from start to finish. Our team is composed of professional painters and leaders in the industry. We are committed to getting the job done right, on time, and within budget. Our commitment to customer satisfaction has led to our industry\\-leading repeat and referral performance.

Come work with us and find out why we have been voted the Best Painting Contractor in MN for three years in a row; 2021, 2022 and 2023\\.

**Primary Responsibilities:**

* Administrative support to the Carpentry, Wallcovering and Commercial Divisions.
* Schedule jobs for our Carpentry, Wallcovering and Commercial Divisions.
* Answer phones (split phone responsibilities with our other Administrative Coordinator), assist customers with general needs and some pre\\-selling.
* Enter leads from phone calls, web generations and all social media.
* Calendar management for the team\\-setting appointments with customers and keeping the teams calendars current.
* Help coordinate customers and crews from the initial lead to the completion of the project and beyond.
* Opportunity to help with blueprint job estimating and Wallcovering estimates.
* Problem\\-solving, which frees everyone up to excel in their roles.
* Miscellaneous office tasks such as office supply orders, planning birthday lunches, and preparing sales folders for the team.
* Back up for our other Administrative Coordinator.
* Create and improve systems, processes, and procedures.

**Qualifications:**

* Outstanding customer service and communication skills.
* Excellent time management skills, ability to multitask and prioritize workload.
* Attention to detail and problem\\-solving skills.
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
* Strong organizational and planning skills.
* Data Entry: Excellent computer skills.
* Knowledge of clerical practices and procedures.

This position is based at our office in Wayzata.

We look forward to hearing from you!

title: Carpenter
description:
Carpenter for Exterior Residential Painting PrepDurahome Painting Plus


Join Our Dynamic Team at Durahome Painting Plus as a Carpenter!Enhance Your Career with Hands\\-On Experience and Fine Craftsmanship


About Durahome Painting Plus:At Durahome Painting Plus, we’re not just painting surfaces; we’re creating lasting impressions. As leaders in the painting and finishing industry, we pride ourselves on delivering beautiful, durable projects with exceptional customer service and craftsmanship. We’re on the lookout for a Carpenter who’s more than just a professional \\- someone who’s passionate about woodworking and fine craftsmanship, ready to play a critical role in shaping our company’s future.


Your Role:

* Prepare for Perfection: Replace boards and fix up the exterior of homes prior to painting, ensuring a perfect foundation for our painting projects.
* Diagnose and Estimate: Walk around the house with the homeowner to diagnose what should be replaced and provide an accurate estimate for the cost of the work.
* Organize Materials: Order and gather necessary materials and supplies to ensure the project runs smoothly and efficiently.
* Document the Process: Use the app CompanyCam to document the process, providing clear and detailed records of the work performed.
* Maintain Quality Standards: Ensure all work meets our high standards of quality and craftsmanship, delivering exceptional results for our clients.


Your Skill Set:

* Experienced Carpenter: Previous experience as a carpenter is required, with a strong understanding of woodworking and exterior home repairs.
* Tech\\-Savvy and Solution\\-Oriented: Demonstrate proficiency in using technology efficiently, particularly for documentation and communication.
* Project Management Pro: Strong project management, analysis, and critical thinking skills to handle multiple tasks and projects.
* Exceptional Communicator: Outstanding written and verbal communication skills to ensure clarity and purpose in all interactions.
* Customer Service Champion: Deliver exceptional customer service, making every interaction memorable and meaningful.
* Cool Under Pressure: Maintain focus and composure in fast\\-paced situations.
* Commitment to Quality: A service\\-oriented attitude that underscores dedication to quality and professional excellence.
* Bilingual Brilliance: Spanish language skills? That’s a bonus we admire!


Your Qualifications:

title: Painting Project Manager
description:
Durahome Painting Plus, a premier painting company based in Minneapolis, MN, is seeking a dynamic Painting Project and Production Manager to join our passionate team. This role is integral to our mission of delivering exquisite painting, staining, and finishing projects while ensuring unparalleled customer satisfaction. If you’re a proactive individual who values professionalism, thrives in a dynamic environment, and finds satisfaction in executing projects from inception to completion, we want to connect with you!


Position Overview:

* Industry: Painting
* Employment Type: Full\\-Time
* Salary Range: $60,000 \\- $90,000 per year
* Location: On\\-site at our Production Department in Minneapolis, MN
* Functions: Project Management, Production Coordination, Accounting, and Administrative


Key Responsibilities:

* Manage multiple subcontractor crews simultaneously, ensuring project quality and timely completion.
* Closely monitor budgets to maintain required profit margins.
* Provide real\\-time project updates to the owner, customers, and stakeholders using dedicated software.
* Organize the painting schedules aligning crew availability with customer preferences.
* Lead the customer journey from initial meetings, site visits, quality checks to final project reviews.
* Review new projects from estimators and allocate them to suitable crews.
* Engage with subcontractors to negotiate prices aligning with our profitability standards.
* Perform quality checks on job sites, ensuring adherence to company standards and customer satisfaction.
* Cultivate positive relationships, encouraging Google reviews, customer testimonials, and referrals.
* Secure final payments upon project completion.


Qualifications:

* Proficient in computer and technology use.
* Prior experience in construction management or estimating is an advantage.
* Familiarity with the painting industry is desirable.
* Robust project management, analytical, and problem\\-solving skills.
* Outstanding time\\-management, multitasking, and organizational capabilities.
* Proficient written and verbal communication skills.
* Leadership qualities and ability to work collaboratively.
* Bilingual proficiency in English and Spanish is a significant asset, but not mandatory.


What Makes Durahome Painting Plus Unique:We’re not just a painting company; we're a team of professionals dedicated to perfection and customer satisfaction. Our values revolve around honesty, transparency, efficiency, and mutual respect. Each day, we uphold the Durahome Painting Plus standards, ensuring that every team member contributes and thrives in our collaborative environment. We believe in evolution and continuous improvement, ensuring we always deliver our promises and exceed expectations.


Bonus Points For:

* An appreciation for power washing or spray painting videos.
* The ability to brainstorm creative solutions.
* Bilingual (Spanish and English) proficiency.


If you're ready to embark on a rewarding journey with Durahome Painting Plus, leveraging your skills while contributing to our collective growth, we encourage you to apply!


About Durahome Painting Plus:Located in Minneapolis, MN, Durahome Painting Plus stands for excellence, professionalism, and unparalleled customer service. Our projects reflect our dedication, while our repeat clientele mirrors our commitment to quality and satisfaction.


Apply now to be part of a team that's transforming homes and businesses with unmatched expertise and passion.

description:

title: Estimator/Sales
description:
FirstChoice Professional Painting is seeking a highly motivated and talented Estimator/Sales Person to join our dynamic team. We are a professional painting company dedicated to providing commercial and residential painting services with integrity and craftsmanship to the South Florida market with a highly dedicated, inspired, and caring team. With our main office and business located on the east coast of Florida, this person would be responsible for developing our business on the west coast of Florida.

  

This is a fantastic opportunity to contribute to our mission and make a real impact in the painting industry.

  

Job Title: Estimator



Location: Tampa Bay Area



Employment Type: Full\\-Time



Salary Range: Commission\\-Based \\- Potential to earn $75,000\\+

 **Responsibilities:**

  

* Evaluate project requirements and specifications to determine the scope of work.
* Conduct on\\-site inspections to assess the condition of surfaces, measure dimensions, and identify any additional preparation or repairs needed.
* Prepare accurate and detailed cost estimates for labor, materials, equipment, and subcontractor services.
* Collaborate with clients, architects, and project managers to understand project goals, provide recommendations, and offer value engineering solutions when appropriate.
* Prepare comprehensive project proposals and bid documents.
* Maintain a database of material prices, labor rates, and subcontractor costs to ensure accurate estimating.
* Stay updated on industry trends, painting techniques, and regulatory requirements.
* Join professional organizations relating to client base.

  


**Requirements:**

  

* Previous experience as a painting contractor estimator or in a similar role.
* Strong knowledge of painting techniques, materials, and industry standards.
* Proficiency in estimating software and tools.
* Excellent mathematical and analytical skills.
* Attention to detail and the ability to produce accurate and timely estimates.
* Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
* Valid driver's license.

  


**Preferred Qualifications:**

  

* Certification or training in estimating or project management.
* Sales experience in painting industry
* Experience working with commercial painting projects.
* Knowledge of cost control and budget management principles.

  


**Key Skills and Abilities:**

  

* Strong mathematical and analytical skills for accurate cost calculations.
* Excellent communication and negotiation skills to collaborate with clients and subcontractors.
* Time management and organizational skills to meet project deadlines.

  


**About our company:**

  

FirstChoice is a painting contractor located in Deerfield Beach, FL. Providing commercial and residential painting services with integrity and craftsmanship to the South Florida market with a highly dedicated, inspired, and caring team.

 **Benefits:**

  

PTO



Paid Holidays

  

FirstChoice Professional Painting is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. Applicants of all backgrounds are encouraged to apply.

  

Please note that all information provided by applicants will be treated confidentially and used solely for the purpose of evaluating qualifications and suitability for the position.

  

We look forward to reviewing your application!
